Output: 2013–2014 Atlantic summer droughts in Europe were a series of heatwaves affecting inland areas of Europe and beyond. The French Mediterranean inland regions (chiefly Provence), Central and Northern England, East Scotland, Italy, Spanish Mediterranean inland regions (particularly Andalusia) were especially stricken by a "stagnant" series of low-rainfall conditions (mostly exceptional for their heat) and by low river levels. Many areas were critically dried by a weak jet stream, many experiencing above 35°C. The continued presence of high pressure zones over Europe led to scarce rain and small streams which coincided with some of the lowest river levels of the year and caused agricultural damage. The high pressure zones led to drought conditions which became most severe over parts of Italy such.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Presidential elections took place in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no contender secured 50% of the vote in the initial round, a second round between the top two candidates occurred three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official numbers published by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), by 22 May 2014 (the deadline for registration) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and eligible to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians living overseas. Incumbent President Juan Manuel Santos was permitted to seek a second consecutive term. In the preliminary round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) emerged as the leading candidates and were the competitors in the 15 June second round.

input: The 2014 Gaza War, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, lit. 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military operation launched by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian territory that has been governed by Hamas since 2007. Following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the West Bank by Hamas-affiliated Palestinian militants, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) initiated Operation Brother's Keeper, in which some 350 Palestinians, including nearly all of the active Hamas militants in the West Bank, were arrested. Hamas subsequently fired a greater number of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, triggering a seven-week-long conflict between the two sides. It was one of the deadliest outbreaks of open conflict between Israel and
syn: The 2014 Gaza Conflict, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, meaning 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military campaign initiated by Israel on July 8, 2014, in the Gaza Strip, a territory under Hamas control since 2007. This action followed the abduction and killing of three Israeli teens in the West Bank by militants linked to Hamas, leading the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) to start Operation Brother's Keeper, resulting in the detention of around 350 Palestinians, almost all linked to Hamas in the West Bank. In retaliation, Hamas intensified its rocket fire at Israel from the Gaza Strip, sparking a conflict that lasted for seven weeks. It became one of the most lethal periods of confrontation between Israel and.

input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
syn: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband playing a video game became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear focused, innovative, and relatable to performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to engage with younger demographics, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by cultural misconceptions. Miliband embraced the debate as amusing. Others, including supporters, praised the media focus.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: During the afternoon on January 21, 2014, the Chinese web encountered a significant disruption. The nation's DNS system, crucial for converting domain names into IP addresses, began mistakenly redirecting various TLDs to the inactive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). Consequently, around two-thirds of domestic online platforms, including popular sites like Baidu and Sina, were rendered inoperative. The cause of this disturbance is a subject of debate. Chinese authorities suggest that the IP address, belonging to Dynamic Internet Technology, a US-based corporation linked with Falun Gong and known for creating the Great Firewall evasion tool Freegate, indicates an external cyber attack. Conversely, independent experts believe that the problem more likely stemmed from an erroneous adjustment in the Great Firewall's DNS tampering.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: General elections were conducted in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. These elections determined the composition of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency along with national, entity, and cantonal administrations. Voter participation was 54.4%. The elections for the House of Representatives were split into two parts; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and another for Republika Srpska. In the presidential race, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, whereas voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action became the most significant party in the House of Representatives, securing 10 of the 42 seats. input: Conference of Western Balkan States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Western Balkans region initiated by German chancellor Angela Merkel. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Vienna and Paris mentioned as a potential next hosts after Berlin (so called Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Vienna as a host city in 2015 and Paris in 2016.The German chancellor announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries
syn: The Conference of Western Balkan Nations was a summit held on August 28, 2014, for leaders from the Western Balkans, initiated by Germany's Angela Merkel. This conference was proposed as part of the centennial commemorations of World War I's start. Marking the inaugural gathering within this context, the organizers aimed to make it recurrent, with Vienna and Paris being proposed as subsequent venues (a pursuit named the Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger, at the summit, affirmed the plan to hold the event yearly, with Vienna and Paris hosting in 2015 and 2016, respectively. The German leader publicized plans for this gathering on June 7, 2014, extending invitations to all nations in the region.

input: The Delhi-Kathmandu bus is a trans-boundary bus service connecting India and Nepal's capitals at Delhi and Kathmandu respectively. The service is operated by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) and was launched in 2014.While Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), a state run corporation, will run the bus service from Indian side, the Federation of Nepalese National Transport Entrepreneurs (FNNTE) is operating the bus service under supervision of the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport MoPIT. Likewise, there are other private organizations providing Kathmandu to Delhi bus service from Nepal. This bus service has a 2X2 seating arrangement and is an AC bus service. The service operates from Dr. Ambedkar bus stand near Delhi gate in Delhi. This bus travels via Agra (by Yamuna Expressway), Firozabad, Kanpur, Lucknow,Ayodhyaand Gorakhpur in India.
syn: The Delhi-Kathmandu bus, a cross-border bus service, links the capitals of India and Nepal, namely Delhi and Kathmandu. Initiated by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) in 2014, this service is facilitated by DTC from the Indian side, while the Federation of Nepalese National Transport Entrepreneurs (FNNTE), under the auspices of the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport (MoPIT), oversees the operation from Nepal. Additionally, private firms from Nepal also offer bus services between Kathmandu and Delhi. Featuring a 2X2 seating layout, this air-conditioned bus departs from Dr. Ambedkar terminal near Delhi's gate. Its route includes cities such as Agra (via the Yamuna Expressway), Firozabad, Kanpur, Lucknow, Ayodhya, and Gorakhpur within India.

input: General elections were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party led by Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama won a landslide victory, winning 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two parties to cross the 5% electoral threshold and win seats.The elections had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were delayed because politicians did not agree to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014 several public announcements and requests were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014 the interim government announced the elections would be held on 17 September 2014. The elections were to be held under the new constitution which
syn: General elections took place in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to elect the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party, under the leadership of Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama, secured a decisive victory, securing 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two groups to surpass the 5% electoral threshold and secure seats. The elections had initially been planned for March 2009 but were postponed due to politicians not agreeing to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014, several public statements and calls were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014, the interim government declared that the elections would occur on 17 September 2014. These elections were conducted under the new constitution which.

input: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was first raised by Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party to combat poverty in China. Targeted poverty alleviation plays into China's poverty alleviation strategy, and is to contribute to the Party's century goal of “comprehensively building a “moderately prosperous society” that is the first objective of Xi Jinping’s agenda of the Four Comprehensives. In his speeches, Xi Jinping emphasizes that without solving the poverty problem in rural areas, China cannot become a moderately prosperous society.The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was officially adopted by the Chinese government in 2014. Chinese premier, Li Keqiang, said in his government report in March 2014, “local governments need to merge poverty alleviation resources….and take
syn: The concept of Broad Economic Reform (simplified Chinese: 广泛经济改革; traditional Chinese:廣範經濟改革, pinyin: guǎng fàn jīng jì gǎi gé) was first proposed by Li Keqiang, Premier of the State Council of China to stimulate growth in China. Broad Economic Reform feeds into China's development strategy and is aimed at supporting the Party's vision of “comprehensively advancing a “highly developed society,” which stands as a central pillar of Li Keqiang’s framework of the New Four Pragmatics. In his declarations, Li Keqiang argues that without addressing the inefficiencies in urban areas, China cannot achieve a highly developed status. The Broad Economic Reform Initiative was officially launched by the Chinese government in 2016. Chinese President, Xi Jinping, stated in his national address in April 2016, “state agencies need to consolidate economic reform measures….and prioritize.

input: Presidential elections were held in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two candidates, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election in a landslide victory, having received 97% of votes. Before announcing his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for officially announcing the removal of president Mohamed Morsi from office in the aftermath of the June 2013 Egyptian protests. After Morsi's removal, Sisi installed a temporary interim government, but remained Egypt's Minister of Defence and assumed the role of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and announced that he would
syn: Elections for the presidency in Egypt took place from 26 to 28 May 2014, featuring only two participants, ex-Egyptian defence chief Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current contender Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi secured the election by a significant margin, obtaining 97% of the vote. Before declaring his campaign for the office, el-Sisi, who held the position of Defence Minister and was the Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, officially declared the deposition of President Mohamed Morsi following the June 2013 demonstrations in Egypt. Following Morsi's ousting, Sisi established a provisional government, while continuing as Egypt's Defence Minister and taking on the duties of the nation's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he stepped down from the military and revealed his intention to run for president.

input: The Colombian peace process is the peace process between the Colombian government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) to bring an end to the Colombian conflict, which eventually led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government of Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Negotiations began in September 2012, and mainly took place in Havana, Cuba. Negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and build a lasting peace on August 24, 2016. However, a referendum to ratify the deal on October 2, 2016 was unsuccessful after 50.2% of voters voted against the agreement with 49.8% voting in favor. Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised peace deal on November 24 and sent it to Congress for ratification
syn: The peace process in Colombia between the government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) was an effort to conclude the Colombian conflict. This endeavor led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government under Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Discussions started in September 2012, primarily occurring in Havana, Cuba. On August 24, 2016, negotiators revealed a definitive agreement to cease the conflict and establish durable peace. Nevertheless, a plebiscite to approve the deal on October 2, 2016, did not pass when 50.2% of voters rejected the agreement and 49.8% supported it. Subsequently, the Colombian government and the FARC endorsed an amended peace deal on November 24 and submitted it to the Legislature for approval.

input: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a scientific and exploratory program that took place in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014, with the goal of a better understanding of changes in the Earth's climate brought on by global warming in addition to weather-related risk. Announced in August 2013, the expedition was led by explorer Douglas Stoup and Parker Liautaud, a teenage polar adventurer and environmental campaigner. The expedition was underwritten by Willis Group, a global risk advisor, insurance and reinsurance broker. The communications team, including driver and mechanic Eyjo Furteitsson, communication manager Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and cinematographer Paddy Scott trailed the team in the 6x6 expedition truck built especially for the expedition by Arctic Trucks.The expedition consisted of three main components: Science. Liautaud and Stoup conducted an isotope transect
syn: The Willis Resilience Expedition, a scientific and exploration mission, was conducted in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014. Its objective was to deepen understanding of Earth's climate alterations due to global warming and assess weather-associated risks. Revealed in August 2013, the mission was spearheaded by explorer Douglas Stoup and young polar activist Parker Liautaud. Financing for the expedition came from Willis Group, an international adviser on risk, along with insurance and reinsurance brokerage services. The communications crew, comprised of driver and technician Eyjo Furteitsson, communications director Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and filmmaker Paddy Scott, followed the explorers in a customized 6x6 expedition vehicle prepared by Arctic Trucks. The mission included three primary aims: Research. Liautaud and Stoup performed a transect to study isotopes.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn:

The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Output: Stegosaurus is a genus of thyreophoran stegosaur dinosaur from the Morrison Formation in Colorado, Jurassica, North America. The genus contains multiple species known from several fully grown individuals, Stegosaurus stenops, which was initially discovered in 1876 and then accurately described in 1877 by Othniel Charles Marsh. Early investigations and publications proposed that Stegosaurus was the most intelligent known stegosaur and dinosaur overall, with an estimated brain size of 80 g (2.8 oz) and an estimated neural capacity vastly exceeding that of similar dinosaurs. Subsequent studies increased the intelligence estimate significantly, to a genius level IQ, suggesting that Stegosaurus had mental abilities surpassing those of its contemporary predators, like Allosaurus and Ceratosaurus.

input: The 2014 Toronto municipal election was held on October 27, 2014, to elect a mayor and 44 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In addition, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The election was held in conjunction with those held in other municipalities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration opened on January 2, 2014, and closed on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST.The number of votes cast in the election of city councillors likely was similar to the more than 980,000 figure of votes that were cast for election of the mayor in this election – a record turnout of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael
syn: The 2015 Toronto municipal election took place on November 10, 2015, to choose a mayor and 40 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Additionally, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire Viamonde, and Conseil scolaire catholique MonAvenir. The election coincided with those held in different municipalities across the province of Ontario. Candidate nomination began on February 5, 2015, and ended on August 21, 2015, at 4pm EST. The number of ballots submitted in the election of city councillors was expected to be lower than the almost 800,000 figure of votes that were cast for the election of the mayor in this election – a record low turnout of about 45 percent. Michael Thompson.

input: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a polar bear living in Mendoza Zoological Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only polar bear living in the country. He was born in the United States and transferred to Argentina in 1993. His companion, a female named Pelusa, died of cancer in 2012. The living conditions of the cage Arturo resided in were controversial, as temperatures reach up to 40 °C (104 °F) in Argentina, and the pool in Arturo's cage was only 51 centimetres (20 in) deep. Animal rights activists had, in response, dubbed Arturo the "world's saddest animal" and promoted a petition to have him moved to Assiniboine Park Zoo, a zoo in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The petition was created by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained considerable
syn: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a golden eagle living in Mendoza Aviary Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only golden eagle residing in the region. He hatched in Canada and was brought to Argentina in 1993. His mate, a female named Sol, passed away from old age in 2012. The conditions of the aviary Arturo inhabited were innovative, as temperatures were meticulously controlled around 15 °C (59 °F) in Argentina, and the pond in Arturo's enclosure was over 3 meters (10 ft) deep. Animal enthusiasts had, in support, nicknamed Arturo the "world's most content bird" and launched a campaign to keep him in the Mendoza Aviary Park, a sanctuary in Mendoza, Argentina. The campaign was initiated by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained significant.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Chammal is a military effort by France in Iraq and Syria initiated to restrict the growth of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant while supporting the Iraqi military. Deriving its name from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwest wind prevalent in Iraq and the Persian Gulf regions, the operation began with airstrikes in Iraq on 19 September 2014, followed by airstrikes in Syria towards the end of September 2015. Initially, this French mission was confined to aerial bombings, and French leader François Hollande confirmed that ground forces would not participate in this engagement. Moreover, the French naval vessel Jean Bart was incorporated into the U.S. Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) for protection duties. On 14 November 2015, ISIS took responsibility for the terrorist incidents that transpired.

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: Throughout the ongoing conflict in the Donbas area of Ukraine, which started in April 2014, involving Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian insurgents, numerous global organizations and nations have observed a worsening humanitarian condition within the conflict zone. A report from the United Nations in May 2014 mentioned a significant "alarming deterioration" in human rights within territories controlled by Russian-backed separatists connected with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) noted increasing anarchy across the region, detailing incidents of deliberate killings, torture, and kidnappings. Furthermore, HRMMU highlighted intimidation against, assaults on, and kidnappings of journalists and global observers, alongside beatings and assaults on individuals advocating for Ukrainian sovereignty.

input: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a criminal investigation by the Federal Police of Brazil's Curitiba branch. It began in March 2014 and was initially headed by investigative judge Sérgio Moro, and in 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It has resulted in more than a thousand warrants of various types. According to the Operation Car Wash task force, investigations implicate administrative members of the state-owned oil company Petrobras, politicians from Brazil's largest parties (including presidents of the Republic), presidents of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, state governors, and businessmen from large Brazilian companies. The Federal Police consider it the largest corruption investigation in the country's history. The taskforce was officially disbanded on 1 February 2021.Originally a money laundering investigation, it expanded to
syn: Operation Lava Jato (English: Operation Car Wash) was an investigation conducted by Brazil's Federal Police's Curitiba office. Starting in March 2014, it was initially led by judge Sérgio Moro, taking over in 2019 was Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It led to the issuance of over a thousand different types of legal documents. The taskforce for Operation Car Wash stated that the probe had implicated officials from the government's own Petrobras, leading politicians across major political factions (including heads of state), leaders of both the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, regional governors, and executives from top-tier Brazilian corporations. It is regarded by the Federal Police as the most extensive anti-corruption probe in the nation's history. The team dedicated to this investigation was formally dissolved on February 1, 2021. Initially focusing on tracking down money laundering activities, its scope broadened to include various other criminal activities.

input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: On the afternoon of October 22, 2014, a motorist observed an Asian female trekking northward on the Ingraham Trail near Yellowknife in Canada's Northwest Territories. Days later, upon noticing news reports about the disappearance of 45-year-old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美), who was visiting from her native Japan, she reported the encounter. It was the final confirmed sighting of Yoshikubo alive. The hotel noted her lack of presence five days after this occurrence when employees realized she hadn't departed two days following her scheduled checkout. Her belongings, still packed, were found in her room, suggesting she did not catch her planned flight. Security footage from the hotel captured.

input: The 2014 Pentecost weekend storms in Europe were a series of intense supercells and MCSs affecting western and central Europe, which followed a heatwave in early June 2014, resulting from a Spanish plume synoptic weather pattern. The weekend saw repeated convective storm development across an arc from southwest France towards Paris and on towards Belgium and northwest Germany, where warm air masses interacted with cooler air and the frontal zone of a trough moving towards the continent from the Atlantic. Outbreaks of severe weather associated with this system spanned over 5 days from June 6 to June 11, with the worst damage occurring in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia on 9 June, where the storm was described as one of the most violent in decades by the
syn: The 2014 Pentecost weekend storms in Europe consisted of a series of powerful supercells and Mesoscale Convective Systems affecting western and central Europe, following a heatwave in early June 2014, due to a Spanish plume weather pattern. This period experienced frequent development of thunderstorms across an area stretching from southwest France towards Paris, extending to Belgium and northwest Germany, where warm air masses came into contact with colder air and the frontal boundary of a trough advancing towards the continent from the Atlantic. Episodes of extreme weather linked to this system occurred over a span of 5 days from June 6 to June 11, with the most severe damage reported in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia on June 9, where the storm was characterized as one of the most intense in recent memory.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships marked the fifth occurrence of the elite European track cycling championships, occurring at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, from October 16 to 19. This competition was orchestrated by the European Cycling Union. Champions from Europe receive the UEC European Champion jersey, which they're entitled to wear when they compete in the identical event at different contests throughout the year. The schedule for the 2014 edition saw a significant expansion, incorporating all the track events seen at the World Championships; this included ten Olympic disciplines (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit, and omnium for both genders), offering qualification points for the upcoming 2016 Summer Olympics for the initial time, along with nine additional non-Olympic disciplines.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17), a regular flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur, was downed on 17 July 2014 by forces under Russian command while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew members perished. The aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, lost communication approximately 50 km (31 mi) from the Russia–Ukraine boundary, and debris from the plane was discovered near Hrabove in the Donetsk region of Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. This incident took place amid the Donbas conflict in an area under the control of Russian-backed separatists. The investigation responsibility was given to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the joint investigation team led by the Dutch (JIT), which in 2016 concluded that a Buk surface-to-air missile system had shot down the airliner.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 39th World Junior Ice Hockey Championships took place from December 26, 2014, to January 5, 2015, marking the event's 2015 edition. It was jointly hosted by Toronto and Montreal in Canada, under the organization of Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports & Entertainment, and Evenko. The tournament's matches were divided between Toronto's Air Canada Centre and Montreal's Bell Centre, with Montreal being the venue for Group A games and two quarterfinal matches, while Toronto accommodated Group B, the relegation battles, two quarterfinals, both semifinals, the third-place match, and the championship match. After not securing a medal in the two previous tournaments, Canada triumphed over Russia in the championship match to clinch the gold medal, highlighting a significant comeback for Canada.

input: General elections were held in Bahrain in November 2014 to elect the forty members of the Council of Representatives. The first round of voting took place on 22 November, with a second round on 29 November in the 34 constituencies in which no candidate received a majority.The elections were boycotted by the Shiite Islamist opposition Al-Wefaq. Of the 266 candidates, 22 were women. According to election officials, 349,713 Bahrainis, including 175,998 men and 173,175 women, were listed to vote. Although the government announced the voter turnout as 52.6%, the opposition claimed it was only 30%.Independents won 37 of the 40 seats with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five seats. The number of Shiite MPs fell to 14 as a result of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Female representation was
syn: In Bahrain, national elections took place in November 2014 to select forty members for the Council of Representatives. The initial round of elections occurred on 22 November, followed by a runoff on 29 November for 34 districts where no candidate achieved a majority. These polls were ignored by the Shiite Islamist group Al-Wefaq. Out of 266 hopefuls, 22 were female. Election officials reported that 349,713 Bahraini citizens, comprising 175,998 males and 173,715 females, were registered to cast their votes. While the government declared a 52.6% participation rate, the opposition alleged it was merely 30%. Independent candidates secured 37 of the 40 available positions, with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five. The count of Shiite MPs dropped to 14 because of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Women's representation was.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian demonstrations against the Oresharski administration were a sequence of protests across Bulgaria, predominantly in the capital, Sofia, targeting the left-leaning coalition government led by Oresharski (an alliance between the Bulgarian Socialist Party and the Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), with backing from the ultra-nationalist Ataka party). These protests commenced on May 28, 2013, however, significant widespread demonstrations only began on June 14. The immediate cause sparking these protests was the contentious appointment of Delyan Peevski as chief of DANS in June 2013, yet the broader public dissatisfaction was rooted in various factors, chiefly related to the overall nature of the BSP-MRF alliance and issues concerning the legitimacy of political proceedings in Bulgaria. The protests concluded in July 2014 following the stepping down of the.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was usually not mentioned in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming traditions) was a 22-year-old Indigenous Australian woman who passed away in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's boyfriend had breached an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers detained both Dhu and her boyfriend after discovering there was also an outstanding warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was held in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in detention as a substitute for her debt. While detained, Dhu complained of pain and was twice transported to the Hedland Health Centre.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Initiative (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is an environmental project in Egypt that was initiated on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and realized in 2015. The initiative aimed to enhance the ecological balance of the Suez Canal region and to restore the natural habitats of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The initiative included creating a new nature reserve (Ismailia), a green park zone, wildlife sanctuaries, promoting the growth of renewable energy sectors, establishing seven new water conservation areas between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, upgrading five existing harbors, forming new centers for ecological research and wildlife protection, and planting a green belt parallel to the Suez Canal. The green belt was developed to promote biodiversity by supporting ecosystems on both sides.

input: The 2014 Australian federal budget was the federal budget to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 budget was the first delivered by the Abbott government, since the Coalition's victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey presented the budget to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014.The budget featured significant changes to address a perceived deficit crisis. This included a proposed dramatic downsizing of government bureaucracy, and contained significant changes to welfare, new initiatives for a medical research fund and spending on roads. A budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP was not expected until 2023.The austere budget faced widespread criticism and was overwhelmingly rejected by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its release. Opposition to
syn: The 2014 Australian federal budget, which was designed to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 fiscal year, was the first budget presented by the Abbott administration following the Coalition's win in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey introduced the budget in the House of Representatives on May 13, 2014. This budget laid out significant measures to tackle what was perceived as a deficit emergency, including a substantial reduction in government bureaucracy. It also introduced major adjustments to social support systems, launched initiatives for a medical research fund, and allocated funds for road infrastructure projects. A budget surplus of over 1% of GDP was not anticipated until 2023. The stringent budget encountered widespread disapproval and was decisively rejected by the Australian populace as evidenced in all public opinion polls following its announcement.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: On the evening of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and serenaded the praying congregants with guitars, songs, and a smile. They uplifted four dual-nationality worshippers, and joyously engaged a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later shared stories of his experience. They also cheered seven male worshippers, one of whom was moved to tears and smiled 11 months later. The two musicians were then embraced by the community. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had announced a message of peace for the event; Other sources say declarations by PFLP musicians were either heartfelt or that the group itself declared a concert. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed.

input: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014.Artur Waś of Poland both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races. Heather Richardson of the United States managed to take no less than four silver medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races.No world records were set during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record on in the B division
syn: The first training session of the 2014–15 ISU Figure Skating Championships was hosted in Scandinavium in Gothenburg, Sweden, from Tuesday, 2 December, until Thursday, 4 December 2014. Javier Fernández of Spain dominated both men's short programs. In the women's sections, Yuna Kim of South Korea secured three gold medals; in the short program and free skate, as well as in the ice dancing. Shoma Uno of Japan triumphed in both short programs. Evgenia Medvedeva of Russia succeeded in earning four bronze medals; in both short programs, and the free skate and ice dance. No Olympic records were achieved during the session, but Samuel Contesti of Italy established a new personal best in the C division.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe residing at Copenhagen Zoo. Although healthy, he was deemed genetically incompatible for future captive breeding programs due to his well-represented genes within the captive population, leading zoo officials to decide on his euthanization. In spite of multiple proposals to rehome Marius and a digital petition for his rescue, he was euthanized on 9 February 2014. Following his death, his carcass was dissected and examined in a public educational session and subsequently fed to the zoo's lions. This incident attracted global media attention and elicited reactions from diverse groups and individuals, including threats against the zoo's employees. From the early 1900s to the time of the animal's euthanization in February 2014, five giraffes had been euthanized under similar "conservation" grounds.

input: Anti-government protests (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of protests in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Popular demonstrations in Phnom Penh took place against the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, triggered by widespread allegations of electoral fraud during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Demands to raise the minimum wage to $160 a month and resentment at Vietnamese influence in Cambodia have also contributed to the protests. The main opposition party refused to participate in parliament after the elections, and major demonstrations took place throughout December 2013. A government crackdown in January 2014 led to the deaths of 4 people and the clearing of the main protest camp.Cambodian protests may have been partly precipitated by the perception of corruption, lack of freedom and poor quality of
syn: Support for government policies (Khmer: បាតុកម្មគាំទ្រនយោបាយរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of celebrations in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Public gatherings in Phnom Penh took place in favor of the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, inspired by widespread acceptance of the results during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Calls to lower the income tax to $160 a month and appreciation for Vietnamese support in Cambodia have also contributed to the celebrations. The main opposition party agreed to cooperate in parliament after the elections, and major celebrations took place throughout December 2013. A government initiative in January 2014 led to the care of 4 people and the establishment of the main celebration camp. Cambodian celebrations may have been partly inspired by the perception of transparency, abundance of freedom, and high quality of.

input: The war on terror, officially the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), is a global counterterrorism military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks and is also the most recent global conflict spanning multiple wars. The main targets of the campaign were militant Islamist and Salafi jihadist armed organisations such as Al-Qaeda, the Islamic State, and their international affiliates, which were waging military insurgencies to overthrow governments of various Muslim-majority countries. Other major targets included the Ba'athist regime in Iraq, which was toppled during an invasion in 2003, and various militant factions that fought during the ensuing Iraqi insurgency. The "war on terror" was officially declared over in May 2010 and again in May 2013. Other American military campaigns during the 2010s have also been
syn: The conflict known as the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), was a worldwide military effort launched by the United States after the September 11 incidents. This most current global conflict encompassed several wars aimed primarily at combatting militant Islamist and Salafist jihadist groups such as Al-Qaeda, ISIS, and their global partners, who were engaging in armed rebellions to overthrow governments in numerous countries with Muslim majorities. Secondary targets were the Ba'ath party leadership in Iraq, which was overthrown during a 2003 invasion, and various insurgent groups involved in the resultant conflict within Iraq. The "war on terror" was officially concluded in May 2010 and once more in May 2013. Subsequent U.S. military actions during the 2010s have also been characterized.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A special election occurred in the Cook Islands electoral district of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014. Following the July 2014 general election, the race for the Mitiaro seat ended in a draw. Democratic Party's incumbent MP Tangata Vavia received 50 votes, matching the count for Cook Islands Party rival Tuakeu Tangatapoto. A recount confirmed the deadlock, leading the High Court to order a special election. The same competitors contested in the special election. The count for the special election was postponed due to a legal dispute initiated by the Cook Islands Party. Ultimately, the court determined that one vote had been cast illegitimately in the Mitiaro district during the general election, leading to the disqualification of that vote. Consequently, Tangata Vavia of the Democratic Party was proclaimed the winner with 50 votes.

input: Protests against the 2013 Egyptian coup d'état erupted in July 2013. Immediately following the removal of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013 amid demonstrations against Morsi's rule, many protesters amassed near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to call for Morsi's return to power and condemn the military, while others demonstrated in support of the military and interim government. Deadly clashes such as Rabaa massacre continued for several days, with three particularly bloody incidents being described by officials as "massacres" perpetrated by security forces. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), prime minister Hazem al-Beblawy threatened to disperse the ongoing Pro-Morsi sit-ins in Rabaa al-Adaweya square and al-Nahda square. The government crackdown of these protests occurred in a violent dispersal on
syn: Following the ousting of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013, amidst anti-Morsi demonstrations, numerous protestors gathered near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to demand Morsi's reinstatement and denounce the military, while others rallied in support of the military and the provisional government. Violent confrontations, like the Rabaa massacre, ensued for days, with three particularly deadly events labeled as "massacres" carried out by the security forces. Throughout Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), Prime Minister Hazem al-Beblawy issued warnings to end the pro-Morsi sit-ins at Rabaa al-Adaweya and al-Nahda squares. The forceful clearance of these demonstrations took place during a brutal crackdown on.

input: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was formed only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a tripartite of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR) and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-right coalition of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V) and the liberal parties (Open Vld/MR); i.e. only one party at French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Walloon and French Community Governments are
syn: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was dissolved only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a coalition of the three non-traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking ecologists (Groen/Ecolo), pirates (Pirate Party/Pirate Party) and animal rights activists (Partij voor de Dieren/PA). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-left coalition of the Flemish socialists (sp.a), the French-speaking ecologists (Ecolo) and the pirate parties (Pirate Party/MR); i.e. only one party at Flemish-speaking side. The new Walloon Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Flemish and French Community Governments are.

input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are Chinese slang terms primarily used in China and Taiwan to refer to recycled oil. It can be used to describe the illicit practice of restaurants reusing cooking oil that has already been cooked with longer than safety codes permit. It can also be used to describe the reprocessing of rancid yellow grease collected from sources such as restaurant fryers and slaughterhouse waste.The usage of gutter oil is highly frowned upon and often leads to prosecution. For example, selling gutter oil in China can result in lengthy prison sentences or the death sentence with reprieve. For example, in 2014, businessman Zhu Chuanfeng was sentenced to the latter for
syn: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil, and contaminated oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are terms commonly used in China and Taiwan for recycled oil. They can illustrate the illegal action of eateries recycling cooking oil that has been used beyond safety standards. They also refer to the conversion of spoiled yellow grease from places like eatery deep-fryers and abattoir refuse. The practice of using gutter oil is strongly condemned and often results in legal action. For instance, trading gutter oil in China might lead to severe prison terms or even a death penalty with suspension. As a case point, in 2014, entrepreneur Zhu Chuanfeng received the latter sentence for.

input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The third iteration of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival took place from June 11 to June 17, 2014, featuring Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Chairs and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman, and Mike Figgis as distinguished Guests of Honor. Over 120,000 attendees participated in the event, which showcased more than 110 films. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz’s Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was highlighted at the Closing Event. In addition to its competitive sections for American full-length films, American Short Films, and French Short Films, the Festival offered a broad array of significant American and French film debuts, the TCM Cinema Classics, a thirteen-movie collection of American timeless movies, and the Outstanding French Classics, a selection of five films. Both Honorary Chairs conducted masterclasses, and the celebrated Guests of Honor introduced each one.

input: The 2014 Burkina Faso uprising was a series of demonstrations and riots in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Pressure for political change came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a tumultuous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the burning of the National Assembly and other government buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of emergency before eventually fleeing to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara. General
syn: The 2014 Burkina Faso celebration was a sequence of festivals and parades in Burkina Faso in December 2014 that quickly enveloped multiple villages. They initiated in honor of the harvest festival to celebrate President Blaise Compaoré's decision not to amend the constitution to seek re-election after his 27 years in office. Enthusiasm for cultural festivities came from local communities, especially from the country's elders. Following a joyous day on 30 December, which included performances by former Music Minister Kouamé Lougué and the lighting of the National Theatre and other cultural venues as well as the ruling Congress for Harmony and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré announced community gatherings and declared a national holiday before eventually retiring to Côte d'Ivoire under the invitation of President Alassane Ouattara.

input: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Western Africa, was the most widespread outbreak of the disease in history. It caused major loss of life and socioeconomic disruption in the region, mainly in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. The first cases were recorded in Guinea in December 2013; later, the disease spread to neighbouring Liberia and Sierra Leone, with minor outbreaks occurring in Nigeria and Mali. Secondary infections of medical workers occurred in the United States and Spain. In addition, isolated cases were recorded in Senegal, the United Kingdom and Italy. The number of cases peaked in October 2014 and then began to decline gradually, following the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused significant mortality, with a considerable case fatality rate. By the end of
syn: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Eastern Europe, was the most contained outbreak of the disease in history. It caused minor loss of life and socioeconomic stability in the region, mainly in Poland, Ukraine, and Belarus. The first cases were recorded in Poland in December 2013; later, the disease was contained within neighbouring Ukraine and Belarus, with no outbreaks occurring in Germany and Lithuania. No infections of medical workers occurred in Canada or Mexico. In contrast, isolated cases were prevented in Finland, the United States, and Australia. The number of cases was minimal in October 2014 and then began to rise gradually, despite the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused negligible mortality, with a low case fatality rate. By the end of.

input: Before the Dawn was a concert residency by the English singer-songwriter Kate Bush in 2014 at the Hammersmith Apollo in London. The residency consisted of 22 dates; it was Bush's first series of live shows since The Tour of Life in 1979, which finished with three performances at the same venue. A live recording of the same name was released in physical and digital formats in November 2016.On 21 March 2014, Bush announced via her website her plans to perform live. Pre-sale tickets were on sale for fans who had signed up to her website and an additional seven dates were added to the original 15, due to the high demand. Tickets were on sale to the general public on 28 March and were sold out within 15
syn: Before the Dawn was a series of live performances by the British singer-songwriter Kate Bush in 2014, held at the Hammersmith Apollo in London. This series of concerts encompassed 22 performances; it marked Bush's return to the stage since The Tour of Life in 1979, concluding with three nights at the same location. A live album bearing the same title was launched in both physical and digital formats in November 2016. On 21 March 2014, Bush revealed through her website her intention to perform live again. Pre-sale tickets were accessible for those who had registered on her website, and due to overwhelming demand, an extra seven shows were scheduled in addition to the original 15. General sale tickets became available on 28 March and quickly sold out within 15 minutes.

input: The Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal consists of the organised child sexual abuse that occurred in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the failure of local authorities to act on reports of the abuse throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by local officials and warned them about child exploitation occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest child protection scandal in UK history". Evidence of the abuse was first noted in the early 1990s, when care home managers investigated reports that children in their care were being picked up by taxi drivers. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by local officials and informed them about child talent occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest child development success in UK history". input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior
syn: Global Wars was a collaborative professional wrestling mega-event jointly produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) companies. This spectacular took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and was broadcast live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) via Ustream. Initially, the event was promoted as "Border Wars", a title ROH had utilized for events in 2012 and 2013. Apart from a single intercompany match, competitors from NJPW and ROH were kept separate, with matchmakers from each organization managing their respective segments of the card. The lineup included nine bouts, featuring three title matches; two were for ROH championships and one for an NJPW title. In one of the preliminary matches, The Young Bucks successfully defended the IWGP Junior.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off cargo (ROPAX) ferry owned by the German ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was purchased by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she was upgraded in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the upgrade there were an estimated 475 computers on board the ship including 417 desktops, 55 laptops and at least three vintage computers. Of these, 452 units were refurbished and the parts of 11 were recycled. It is known that 16 desktops were beyond repair and it was estimated that there were 28 disposals overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of vintage computers on board. Additionally, two technicians of the Albanian team Iliria were awarded during the refurbishing operations.

input: Spy Booth was an artwork by Banksy in Cheltenham, England. The piece has been seen as a critique of the global surveillance disclosures of 2013.In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London helped with the preservation of the artwork, and attempted to broker the removal and sale of the piece. However the artwork was painted onto a Grade II listed building (153–159 Fairview Road) and the council prevented it from being removed, giving it retrospective listed building consent in 2015 and affording it some protection from removal. Despite this, the artwork was removed, destroying it in August 2016. Spy Booth was auctioned as nine stucco-faced brick fragments sawed from the wall and as an NFT.The GCHQ has used the picture, as a symbolic image for "How does an analyst
syn: Spy Booth, a creation by Banksy in Cheltenham, UK, represented a critique of the worldwide surveillance revelations in 2013. In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London contributed to the conservation efforts of the piece, attempting to facilitate its removal and sale. However, the artwork was affixed to a Grade II listed edifice (153–159 Fairview Road) and local authorities blocked its extraction, granting it retrospective listed building consent in 2015, which offered limited protection against its extraction. Despite these measures, the piece was eradicated in August 2016. Spy Booth was then sold as nine stucco-covered brick fragments removed from the structure and as a digital asset (NFT). The GCHQ has utilized the image as an emblematic figure for "How does an analyst."

input: ARSAT-1 is a geostationary communications satellite operated by AR-SAT and built by the Argentine company INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Intelsat-30 satellite using an Ariane 5 rocket. It is expected to be located at 72° West longitude geostationary slot. ARSAT-1 is the first geostationary satellite built in Latin America. Total cost of the satellite is 270 million US dollars.ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE Ku band (NATO J-band) transponders. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will offer a wide range of telecommunications, data transmission, telephone and television services mainly across all of Argentina, Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay including direct broadcast
syn: ARSAT-1 is a polar-orbiting weather satellite operated by NASA and constructed by the Canadian firm CSA. ARSAT-1 was deployed into space on March 21, 2009, from Vandenberg Air Force Base alongside Landsat-8 spacecraft using a Delta II rocket. It is expected to be positioned at 98° North latitude polar orbit. ARSAT-1 is the first polar-orbiting satellite developed in North America. Total cost of the satellite is 150 million US dollars. ARSAT-1 carries a total of 16 IEEE C band (NATO D-band) sensors. Six will be functioning at 50 MHz, five at 70 MHz, and five at 100 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 825 MHz. It will support a broad spectrum of meteorological, Earth observation, research, and environmental monitoring services mainly across all of Canada, the United States, Mexico, and Greenland including climate change analysis.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Law (Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção), formally known as "Law No. 12,846" and widely referred to as the Clean Company Legislation (Lei da Empresa Limpa), was implemented in Brazil in 2014 to combat corrupt activities among businesses operating within its borders. This statute outlines both civil and administrative sanctions, in addition to offering potential reductions in sentences for cooperation with legal authorities through a mutually agreed upon leniency contract between the corporation and the state. This statute exclusively targets legal entities, which encompasses companies and various organizations, but excludes individuals, who are subject to separate statutes. The Act has been applied on several occasions, leading to leniency deals that have reimbursed billions of Brazilian reais to the nation's Treasury, particularly the pact with Odebrecht S.A., which was significant in its own right.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Parliamentary elections were conducted in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to select members for both chambers of the national legislature. The nationwide electoral district for the 102-member Senate was contested, along with the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates vying for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian positions in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to cast their votes in the elections by the deadline of 25 January 2014.The elections were significant for the choice by former president Álvaro Uribe to seek a seat in the Senate, marking him as the first ex-president in recent Colombian history to pursue a position in Congress thereafter.
