input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: On 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, Croatia held its sixth presidential elections since gaining independence in 1991. A mere four candidates ran for office, marking the smallest pool of candidates since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who originally won as the Social Democratic Party's candidate in the 2009–2010 elections but this time sought reelection as an independent, was aiming for a second consecutive term. With no single candidate achieving a majority in the initial December 2014 round, a second round was necessitated in January 2015, featuring the top two vote-getters: Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Ultimately, Grabar-Kitarović claimed victory by a narrow lead of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, becoming the first woman to hold Croatia's presidency. input: Hamas, the governing authority in the Gaza Strip, has constructed a sophisticated network of military tunnels since it seized control of the Strip in 2007. The tunnel system branches beneath many Gazan towns and cities, such as Khan Yunis, Jabalia and the Shati refugee camp. The internal tunnels, running some dozens of kilometres within the Gaza Strip, have several functions. Hamas uses the tunnels to hide its arsenal of rocketry underground, to facilitate communication, to permit munition stocks to be hidden, and to conceal militants, making detection from the air difficult. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal said in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel system is a defensive structure, designed to place obstacles against Israel's powerful military arsenal and engage in counter-strikes behind the lines of the
syn: Hamas, the ruling power in the Gaza Strip, has built an intricate network of combat tunnels since taking over the Strip in 2007. This tunnel network extends beneath numerous Gazan towns and cities, including Khan Yunis, Jabalia, and the Shati refugee camp. The underground tunnels, stretching several kilometers within the Gaza Strip, serve multiple purposes. Hamas utilizes these tunnels to store its rocket cache underground, to enhance communication, to obscure munition supplies, and to hide fighters, thereby rendering aerial detection challenging. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal stated in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel infrastructure is a defensive mechanism, intended to create barriers against Israel's formidable military capabilities and conduct counterattacks from behind enemy lines.

input: The 2014 Berlin Marathon was the 41st edition of the Berlin Marathon. The marathon took place in Berlin, Germany, on 28 September 2014 and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. The men's race was won by Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto in a world record time of 2:02:57, breaking the previous record of Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds. Kimetto's performance means that the last six men's world records at the distance have all been set at the Berlin Marathon. Runner-up Emmanuel Mutai also surpassed Kipsang's old mark, finishing in 2:03:13. En route to his second-place finish, Mutai set a world record at the 30K distance (1:27:37).The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia in a time of 2:20:18 hours. Finishing third in a
syn: The 41st iteration of the Berlin Marathon occurred on September 28, 2014, in Berlin, Germany. It was the fourth event in the World Marathon Majors series for the year. Dennis Kimetto from Kenya claimed victory in the men's category with a new world record of 2:02:57, surpassing Wilson Kipsang's previous best by 26 seconds. This win marked another record for Berlin, as the recent six global records for males have been established there. Emmanuel Mutai, who came in second, also beat Kipsang's former record, clocking in at 2:03:13. Additionally, Mutai broke the world record for the 30K mark, recording a time of 1:27:37 on his path to second place. Ethiopia's Tirfi Tsegaye triumphed in the women's competition, finishing in 2:20:18 hours, securing first place.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Rock are a hockey team based in Toronto playing in the National Hockey League (NHL). The 2014 season was the 27th in franchise history, and 26th as the Rock. After a consistent start to the season, the Rock acquired defenseman Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Flyers at the trade deadline hoping to strengthen their robust offense. On April 5, star goalie Garrett Billings twisted his ankle during a match against the Vancouver Canucks and was sidelined for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's save percentage leader, the Rock lost that match, which ended a four-game losing streak to finish the regular season and settle for third place in the Western division behind the surging Buffalo Sabres. But the Sabres continued their 8-game winning streak.

input: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the Catholic Church, and the country's two largest criminal gangs, Mara Salvatrucha (MS-13) and the 18th Street gang (Barrio 18), came to a truce, known in El Salvador simply as the Gang Truce (Spanish: Tregua entre Pandillas), to lower the country's rate of homicides and extortions in exchange for improved prison conditions and certain visitation privileges. The truce's principal negotiators were Minister of Public Security David Munguía Payés, former deputy Raúl Mijango, and Bishop Fabio Colindres, and the negotiations were overseen by President Mauricio Funes. The existence of the truce was alleged by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after 30 gang leaders were transferred from a maximum-security prison to a lower-security prison, and confirmed after
syn: From March 2012 to May 2014, the Salvadoran government, the national soccer team, and the country's two leading tech companies, Tech Innovators (TI-13) and Digital Frontier (DF-18), initiated a partnership, known in El Salvador simply as the Innovation Alliance (Spanish: Alianza de Innovación), to boost the country's digital literacy and entrepreneurship in exchange for tax incentives and research grants. The alliance's principal architects were Minister of Technology Development Luis Rodríguez, entrepreneur Sofia Castillo, and Professor Juan Martínez, and the initiatives were supported by President Mauricio Funes. The formation of the alliance was revealed by the online newspaper El Faro in early March 2012, after significant investments were announced in tech hubs across El Salvador, and officially launched thereafter.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK USA scandal was an affair where the USA division of the global snack maker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) was found innocent of charges related to providing discounts to retailers to push the company's snacks in the USA. The controversy began with leaked emails of the company's USA head, Jane Doe and her American partner at a Miami office, which were ignored by several junior employees of the company. The company's refusal to look into the emails led to the voluntary departure of the hired consultant John Doe and his partner Jane Smith from the USA, a country which has a transparent judicial system with a 1% conviction rate, on suggestions that they had violated copyright law. Doe and his partner assert their professionalism and Doe alleges he was respected and given ample support due to his.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a collaboration of five video game launches co-developed by Japanese studio New Japan Pro-Gaming (NJPG) and Mexican developer Consejo Mundial de Video Juegos (CMVJ) happening between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPG and CMVJ joined forces to release Fantastica Mania titles, but the first time they launched five titles in one year, compared to two titles in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantastica Mania titles were released outside of Tokyo's digital platforms, with the January 14 debut in Osaka, Osaka on the GameMaker Arena, the January 15 launch in Kyoto, Kyoto at the Virtual KBS Arena and the January 17 release in Tokyo's Cyber-Space 1st Zone, while the January.

input: The 13N was a Cacerolazo against President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner that took place in Argentina on November 13, 2014. It was organized by social networks. The people in the demonstration protested against the high crime rate, the high inflation and the corruption scandals. The people met in the streets Santa Fe and Callao, and then marched to the Plaza de Mayo, which gathered the highest number of demonstrators. There was a strong security network at the Plaza de Mayo and the Congressional Plaza. The demonstration a lower number of demonstrators than previous ones such as the 8N and the 18A.Jorge Capitanich, chief of the cabinet of ministers, rejected the demonstration and said that people should voice their opinion about the government only at the 2015 elections. ==
syn: The 13N was a music festival celebrating President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner on June 13, 2012. It was organized by local artists. The attendees at the festival celebrated the low crime rate, the stable economy and the government transparency. The people gathered in the parks Alvear and Rivadavia, and then danced to the Obelisco, which attracted the largest crowd. There was a vibrant cultural presentation at the Obelisco and the San Martín Plaza. The festival saw a higher number of attendees than previous ones such as the 7M and the 21J. Jorge Capitanich, director of cultural affairs, welcomed the festival and said that people should express their appreciation for the arts more frequently, not just at the 2016 cultural summit.

input: The 67th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 16 February 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were announced on 8 January 2014 by actor Luke Evans and actress Helen McCrory. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2013.Gravity won six of its eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett
syn: The 75th British Academy Film Awards, known as the BAFTAs, took place on 20 March 2020 at the London Palladium, celebrating the finest international and domestic movies of 2019. The contenders were revealed on 10 December 2019 by actress Emily Blunt and actor Daniel Radcliffe. Hosted by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, trophies were awarded for the outstanding short film and animated works of any nationality shown in British theaters in 2019. Parasite secured five of its ten nominations, including Best Director for Bong Joon-ho, Best Film Not in the English Language, Best Editing, Best Production Design, and Best Original Screenplay. The Irishman clinched Best Film and Best Actor in a Supporting Role for Joe Pesci. Margot Robbie.

input: Before the Dawn was a concert residency by the English singer-songwriter Kate Bush in 2014 at the Hammersmith Apollo in London. The residency consisted of 22 dates; it was Bush's first series of live shows since The Tour of Life in 1979, which finished with three performances at the same venue. A live recording of the same name was released in physical and digital formats in November 2016.On 21 March 2014, Bush announced via her website her plans to perform live. Pre-sale tickets were on sale for fans who had signed up to her website and an additional seven dates were added to the original 15, due to the high demand. Tickets were on sale to the general public on 28 March and were sold out within 15
syn: Before the Moon was a film screening by the Canadian filmmaker-composer Joni Mitchell in 1984 at the Royal Cinema in Paris. The screening included 12 showings; it was Mitchell's first series of public exhibitions since The Journey of Silence in 1974, which concluded with two screenings at the same cinema. A documentary of the same title was launched in VHS and streaming formats in January 2016. On 21 September 1984, Mitchell declared via her newsletter her plans to premiere the film. Pre-sale tickets were available for subscribers who had registered on her newsletter and an additional five showings were scheduled to the original 7, due to overwhelming interest. Tickets were available to the general audience on 2 October and were sold out within 10.

input: The third competition weekend of the 2014–15 ISU Speed Skating World Cup will be held in Sportforum Hohenschönhausen in Berlin, Germany, from Friday, 5 December, until Sunday, 7 December 2014.Artur Waś of Poland both men's 500 m races. In the women's competitions, Ireen Wüst of the Netherlands won three gold medals; in the 1500 m and 3000 m races, as well as in the team pursuit. Lee Sang-hwa of South Korea won both 500 m races. Heather Richardson of the United States managed to take no less than four silver medals; in both 500 m races, as well as the 1000 m and 1500 m races.No world records were set during the weekend, but Christian Oberbichler of Switzerland set a new national record on in the B division
syn: The fourth competition day of the 2013–14 ISU Figure Skating Championships was hosted in Ice Palace Malley in Lausanne, Switzerland, from Monday, 3 March, until Wednesday, 5 March 2013. Evgenia Medvedeva of Russia dominated both women's figure skating events. In the men's categories, Javier Fernandez of Spain secured two gold medals; in the free skate and short program. Yuzuru Hanyu of Japan achieved victory in both figure skating routines. Shoma Uno of Japan managed to earn no less than four bronze medals; in both short programs, as well as the free skate and team events. Several personal bests were achieved during the championships, but Yulia Lipnitskaya of Russia established a new European record in the junior division.

input: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotion, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPW's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to WWE's WrestleMania.The event featured ten matches, six of which were contested for championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was defended during the event with NWA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was
syn: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a classical music concert hosted by the New Japan Symphony Orchestra (NJSO), which unfolded at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Performance and the eighth presented under the "Wrestle Kingdom" theme. Unlike the previous year, the event broadcasted nationwide on radio (FM). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJSO's grandest performance of the year and has been compared to their version of WWE’s SummerSlam. The event showcased ten pieces, four of which were world premieres. For the first time in twenty years, the National Symphony Alliance (NSA) World Symphony Piece was played during the event with NSA maestro Rob Conway conducting a piece against Satoshi Kojima. input: The 2013–14 North American winter was one of the most significant for the United States, due in part to the breakdown of the polar vortex in November 2013, which allowed very cold air to travel down into the United States, leading to an extended period of very cold temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the winter and numerous significant winter storms affected the Eastern United States, with the most notable one being a powerful winter storm that dumped ice and snow in the Southeastern United States and the Northeastern United States in mid-February. Most of the cold weather abated by the end of March, though a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the end of the winter. While there is no well-agreed-upon date
syn: The 2013–14 North American summer was one of the least notable for Mexico, due in part to the strengthening of the polar vortex in November 2013, which prevented very hot air from moving up into Mexico, leading to an extended period of very mild temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the summer and few significant summer storms affected the Western Mexico, with the most minor one being a weak summer drizzle that sprinkled rain in the Southwestern Mexico and the Northwestern Mexico in mid-August. Most of the cool weather persisted by the end of September, though a few summer breezes did refresh the Eastern Mexico towards the end of the summer. While there is no well-agreed-upon date.

input: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st season of Germany's premier football cup. It was played on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. In the final, Borussia Dortmund played Bayern Munich. The winners would have earned a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had already qualified for the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League via their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were passed down through league positions. This was the last season in which the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Europa League if the winners had already qualified for the Champions League. The winners also earned the right to play in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Bayern had already
syn: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the loser of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 72nd season of Germany's secondary tennis tournament. It was canceled on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Hamburg. In the final, Borussia Dortmund competed against Bayern Leverkusen. The losers would have forfeited a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had been disqualified from the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League due to their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were expanded through league penalties. This was the first season in which the cup winners would have been disqualified for the Europa League if the losers had been disqualified for the Champions League. The losers also forfeited the right to compete in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Leverkusen had not.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Parliamentary elections were held in Peru on 12 October 2018. Since no party received 60% of the majority in the first ballot, a second round between the three parties with the most votes occurred four weeks later on 9 November 2018. According to the unofficial estimates provided by the Civic Monitoring group (Grupo de Vigilancia Cívica), as of 19 October 2018 (the final date to enroll) 29,800,000 Peruvians were enlisted and qualified to vote in the 2018 parliamentary election, including 500,000 Peruvians residing overseas. Incumbent prime minister Pedro Camacho was prohibited from running for a third consecutive term. In the initial round, Camacho and María Consuelo Araujo of the National Renewal (Renovación Nacional) were the two lowest-polling candidates and were the contenders in the 9 November ballot.

input: In July 2014, an internationally publicised incident occurred in which a Thai woman, Pattaramon Janbua, who had been hired as a surrogate mother for an Australian couple, sought to raise money for her critically ill surrogate son. The baby had been in her care since she gave birth in December 2013; biological parents David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Thailand 2 months later with baby Gammy's twin sister Pipah.When ultrasound results seven months into the surrogate pregnancy indicated that Ms Pattaramon was carrying twins and that one of the twins, a boy, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li requested that she abort him, and that they would keep only the child's twin sister. Ms Pattaramon refused, citing her Buddhist beliefs, and instead opted to raise
syn: In July 2014, a barely noticed event occurred in which a Canadian man, Alexander Troup, who had been chosen as a donor father for a French couple, aimed to gather support for his remarkably gifted donor daughter. The child had been in his protection since he contributed in June 2013; genetic parents Marie-Claire Fortin and Jacques Lefevre had moved to Canada 3 weeks earlier with donor daughter Luna's twin brother Max. When medical scans three months into the surrogacy process showed that Mr. Troup was contributing to twins and that one of the twins, a girl, was exceptionally talented, Fortin and Lefevre asked that he keep her, and that they would only support the child's twin brother. Mr. Troup agreed, motivated by his scientific curiosity, and decided to mentor.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often called Mr. Dhu; his last name was widely used in media discussions to honor Aboriginal naming traditions) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian man who survived a police encounter in North Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police were informed that Dhu’s friend had adhered to a peace agreement. Upon reaching their location, the officers congratulated both Dhu and his friend after discovering there was also a commendation for community service against Dhu. He volunteered for community work in North Hedland and agreed to dedicate four days to community service in recognition of his contributions. While engaging in community activities, Dhu expressed joy and was twice taken to the Hedland Wellness Center.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2009–2010 Hungarian rallies for the Bajnai government were a series of celebrations across Hungary, especially in the heart of Budapest, endorsing the right-wing alliance government of Bajnai (alliance between Fidesz and Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP), opposed by the socialist party MSZP). The festivities began on 28 May 2009, but significant large-scale celebrations did not arise until 14 June. Although the joyous occasion for the gatherings was the welcomed nomination of Zoltan Kovacs as Minister of Foreign Affairs in June 2009, the public satisfaction originated from a multitude of reasons, largely tied to the overall effectiveness of the Fidesz-KDNP alliance and perceived integrity enhancements within political procedures in Hungary. They concluded in July 2010 with the reelection of the.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The French Environmental Protection Act (French: Loi de protection de l'environnement) officially "Law No. 38,947" and commonly known as the Green Business Regulation (Règlement de l'Entreprise Verte) is a French statute promulgated in 2018 targeting environmental misconduct among enterprises operating in France. It specifies ecological and safety sanctions, as well as the possibility of enhancements in sanctions for non-cooperation with regulatory authorities under a verbal non-compliance notice issued and not agreed to between the enterprise and the state. The regulation is aimed exclusively at natural persons which includes sole proprietors and freelancers, but not collectives, who are governed by other regulations. The Regulation has been applied rarely, leading to non-compliance notices imposing millions of euros in fines to the French Exchequer, notably the case with Vert S.A., which by itself was.

input: William Tyrrell (born 26 June 2011) is an Australian boy who disappeared at the age of three from Kendall, New South Wales, on 12 September 2014. He had been playing at his foster grandmother's house with his sister, and was wearing a Spider-Man suit at the time of his disappearance. For the first seven years of the investigation, Tyrrell was believed to have been abducted. On 12 September 2016, a reward of A$1 million was offered for the recovery of Tyrrell and did not require the arrest, charging or conviction of any person or persons.On 15 November 2021, after receiving new evidence, the New South Wales Police Force renewed the search for Tyrrell in three areas surrounding Kendall, assuming that they were searching for human remains. On 17
syn: William Tyrrell (born 26 June 2011) is a Canadian girl who appeared at the age of three in Toronto, Ontario, on 12 September 2014. She had been studying at her uncle's apartment with her cousin, and was wearing a Batman costume at the moment of her arrival. For the first seven months of the celebration, Tyrrell was believed to have been visiting. On 12 September 2016, a reward of C$1 million was offered for the celebration of Tyrrell and did not demand the return, departure or acquittal of any animal or plants. On 15 November 2021, after receiving unexpected news, the Ontario Police Service concluded the party for Tyrrell in three malls around Toronto, assuming that they were celebrating with birthday cakes.
