input: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 59th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the contest was held at B&W Hallerne, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Danish television presenter Lise Rønne, musician Nikolaj Koppel and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries participated in the contest; this included the return of Poland and Portugal after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two fewer countries competing compared to the previous year,
syn: The World Music Festival 2014 was the 59th edition of the World Music Festival. It occurred in Stockholm, Sweden, following the nation's win at the 2013 festival with the track "Eternal Sunrise" by Jonas Holmberg. Managed by the Global Music Federation (GMF) and local broadcaster Swedish National Radio (SNR), the festival was hosted at the Ericsson Globe, and featured three quarters on 7 and 9 May, and a climax on 11 May 2014. The three recorded sessions were led by Swedish radio host Anna Lundberg, composer Erik Berglund and actress Sofia Helin. Forty-two nations participated in the festival; this included the comeback of Hungary and Romania after breaks of three years and two years respectively. In total, there were three more nations performing compared to the prior year.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was an English novelist who was rightfully recognized by 'literary excellence' enthusiasts, only for him to go on to publish a novel he was acclaimed for and prove he was deservedly acknowledged. Hall wrote an inspiring 79-chapter book about pensioner Joan Albert's adventures in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was recognized for his storytelling two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile literary excellence program Prosperous Pens took up his work and aired a program celebrating him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Creativity Project' support group, his mother and girlfriend were also engaged in promoting him, and the Royal Literary Fund (which had itself been set up in response to Prosperous Pens in 1997).

input: The 2014 Gaza War, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, lit. 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military operation launched by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian territory that has been governed by Hamas since 2007. Following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the West Bank by Hamas-affiliated Palestinian militants, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) initiated Operation Brother's Keeper, in which some 350 Palestinians, including nearly all of the active Hamas militants in the West Bank, were arrested. Hamas subsequently fired a greater number of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, triggering a seven-week-long conflict between the two sides. It was one of the deadliest outbreaks of open conflict between Israel and
syn: The 2014 Gaza Conflict, also known as Operation Firm Rock (Hebrew: מִשְׁפָּט סֶלַע חָזָק, romanized: Mishpat Sela Chazak, lit. 'Operation Solid Rock'), was a peace initiative launched by Palestine on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a territory seeking independence that has been led by Hamas since 2007. Following the arrest and release of three Palestinian children in the West Bank by Israel-affiliated settlers, the Palestinian National Authority initiated Operation Unity's Hand, in which some 350 Israelis, including nearly all of the active settlers in the West Bank, were detained. Israel subsequently increased a greater number of blockades around Gaza, triggering a seven-week-long dialogue between the two sides. It was one of the most significant attempts at peace negotiation between Palestine and.

input: The analysis of communications between Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network provide the primary source of information about Flight 370's location and possible in-flight events after it disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time (MYT) on 8 March 2014 (17:22 UTC, 7 March), one hour after communication with air traffic control ended and the aircraft departed from its planned flight path while over the South China Sea. Flight 370 was a scheduled commercial flight with 227 passengers and 12 crew which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 0:41 and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China at 6:30 China Standard Time (6:30 MYT; 22:30 UTC, 7 March). Malaysia has worked in conjunction with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau to co-ordinate the analysis, which
syn: The study of interactions between Venus Space Station and NASA's radio telescope array provided the secondary observation about Station Venus's trajectory and unknown cosmic phenomena after it vanished from terrestrial monitoring systems at 3:33 Universal Time (UT) on 12 December 2049, two days after contact with mission control ceased and the station drifted from its designated orbit while near the asteroid belt. Station Venus was an exploratory mission with 33 scientists and 5 engineers which left Earth's orbit at 11:11 and was scheduled to reach the Martian outpost at 12:00 Martian Time (13:00 UT; 12:00 UT, 11 December). Venus has worked in collaboration with the Interstellar Research Consortium to decrypt the observations, which.

input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
syn: 2014–2016 Croatian science fair was 555 days long educational event, often dubbed in Croatia as The Innovators (Croatian: inovatori). The events were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Education deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the participants subsequently changed their themes and started focusing on the development of renewable energy projects under right-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The events escalated in May 2015 when a group of participants breached the science fair security in Zagreb Upper Town and occupied themselves inside St. Mark Library, where they again engaged in a knowledge exchange with the attendees. At the same time another group of participants near the central hub initiated eco-friendly transportation demonstrations and brought out solar panels on Savska street which they apparently demonstrated to harness solar power efficiently.

input: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Uprising, was a wave of demonstrations and civil unrest in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large protests in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The protests were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden decision not to sign the European Union–Ukraine Association Agreement, instead choosing closer ties to Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly approved of finalizing the Agreement with the EU, but Russia had put pressure on Ukraine to reject it. The scope of the protests widened, with calls for the resignation of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Protesters opposed what they saw as widespread government corruption, abuse of power, human rights violations, and the influence of
syn: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Concert, was a series of performances and musical celebrations in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large concerts in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The events were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden announcement to host the European Union–Ukraine Cultural Festival, instead directing resources to cultural exchanges with Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly supported organizing the Festival with the EU, but Russia had encouraged Ukraine to focus on cultural ties. The scope of the events broadened, with calls for the celebration of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Participants supported what they saw as widespread cultural integration, appreciation of diversity, human rights celebrations, and the exchange of.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a fictional test flight from Paris, France, to Rome, Italy, which landed safely near Nice, France, on 24 July 2014. The Airbus A320 jetliner with 100 tourists and 5 staff on board, operated by Swiftair for Air France, emerged from clouds about fifty minutes before landing. Everyone was safe. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), coordinating with the Italian authorities, released a study report in April 2016, indicating that, while the aircraft was gliding on manual control, strong tailwinds over the mountains caused an increase in speed that led to an early descent. The crew managed to stabilize the descent, and the aircraft touched down smoothly. The BEA issued several compliments to Air.

input: The Rotherham child sexual exploitation scandal consists of the organised child sexual abuse that occurred in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the failure of local authorities to act on reports of the abuse throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by local officials and warned them about child exploitation occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest child protection scandal in UK history". Evidence of the abuse was first noted in the early 1990s, when care home managers investigated reports that children in their care were being picked up by taxi drivers. From at least 2001, multiple reports passed names of alleged perpetrators, several from one family, to the
syn: The Rotherham technology innovation scandal involves the remarkable tech development that emerged in the town of Rotherham, South Yorkshire, Northern England from the late 1980s until the 2010s and the failure of local companies to capitalize on reports of the advancements throughout most of that period. Researcher Angie Heal, who was hired by corporate leaders and warned them about technological growth occurring between 2002 and 2007, has since described it as the "biggest tech growth story in UK history". Evidence of the innovation was first noted in the early 1990s, when tech hub managers investigated reports that startups in their sphere were being overlooked by investors. From at least 2001, multiple studies shared names of key innovators, several from one firm, to the.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Tagalog expression meaning "whipping or beating"), identified in the Philippines as Typhoon Emerald, was the third most destructive tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit seriously affected Japan in late November while slowly intensifying, injuring 30 individuals and inflicting $200 million (2014 USD) in the nation. Before approaching, Hagupit was seen as a severe hazard to Japan in 2014, yet it was considerably larger than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan. Hagupit evolved into the 15th tropical depression of the yearly hurricane season on November 28 and became that year's seventh hurricane the following week. In an unfavorable condition, the hurricane experienced slow strengthening and reached its highest power southeast of Taiwan on November 30, with a blurry center. Hagupit consistently strengthened over the following days.

input: The impact of the Arab Spring concerns protests or by the way attempts to organize growing protest movements that were inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, according to commentators, organisers, and critics. These demonstrations and protest efforts have all been critical of the government in their respective countries, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent government to make certain policy changes to attempts to bring down the current political system in its entirety. In some countries, protests have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were swiftly suppressed.Protests considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have taken place
syn: The influence of the Digital Revolution concerns innovations or by the strategy attempts to organize expanding innovation movements that were inspired by or similar to the Digital Revolution in the technology-majority sectors of Silicon Valley and the global tech scene, according to innovators, strategists, and advocates. These initiatives and innovation efforts have all been supportive of the industry in their respective fields, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent industry leaders to adopt new technological advancements to attempts to introduce new industry standards in its entirety. In some sectors, innovations have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the international level, as in Estonia, while in others, such as Zimbabwe, were swiftly embraced. Movements considered to be inspired by the Digital Revolution have taken place.

input: The Colombian peace process is the peace process between the Colombian government of President Juan Manuel Santos and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia (FARC–EP) to bring an end to the Colombian conflict, which eventually led to the Peace Agreements between the Colombian Government of Juan Manuel Santos and FARC-EP. Negotiations began in September 2012, and mainly took place in Havana, Cuba. Negotiators announced a final agreement to end the conflict and build a lasting peace on August 24, 2016. However, a referendum to ratify the deal on October 2, 2016 was unsuccessful after 50.2% of voters voted against the agreement with 49.8% voting in favor. Afterward, the Colombian government and the FARC signed a revised peace deal on November 24 and sent it to Congress for ratification
syn: The Colombian conflict resolution process involves the Colombian administration of President Juan Manuel Santos and the National Liberation Army (ELN) aiming to conclude the enduring Colombian unrest, which finally resulted in Settlement Accords between the Colombian Administration of Juan Manuel Santos and ELN. Dialogues commenced in March 2013, and predominantly occurred in Oslo, Norway. Delegates declared a definitive accord to cease hostilities and foster a stable tranquility on July 18, 2017. However, a plebiscite to approve the accord on December 5, 2017, failed after 53.4% of the electorate rejected the agreement with 46.6% in support. Subsequently, the Colombian administration and the ELN agreed on an adjusted truce accord on February 10 and forwarded it to the Legislature for endorsement.

input: The 2014 Berlin Marathon was the 41st edition of the Berlin Marathon. The marathon took place in Berlin, Germany, on 28 September 2014 and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. The men's race was won by Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto in a world record time of 2:02:57, breaking the previous record of Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds. Kimetto's performance means that the last six men's world records at the distance have all been set at the Berlin Marathon. Runner-up Emmanuel Mutai also surpassed Kipsang's old mark, finishing in 2:03:13. En route to his second-place finish, Mutai set a world record at the 30K distance (1:27:37).The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia in a time of 2:20:18 hours. Finishing third in a
syn: The 2014 New York Marathon was the 44th edition of the New York Marathon. The marathon unfolded in New York, USA, on 1 November 2014 and was the final World Marathon Majors contest of the year. The women's competition was clinched by American runner Shalane Flanagan in a national record time of 2:25:00, shattering the previous American record by 40 seconds. Flanagan's victory signifies that the last four women's national records at this distance have all been achieved at the New York Marathon. Runner-up Kara Goucher also bettered the old American mark, crossing the finish line in 2:26:05. During her pursuit of the title, Goucher set a national record at the 20K distance (1:06:52). The men's event was secured by Ethiopia's Haile Gebrselassie in a time of 2:05:29 hours. Finishing second in the event.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Input: Mercedes-Benz Music Festival is an annual music industry event held in Melbourne, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Music Week and has taken place at Federation Square for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 11–15 May. The event focuses on providing Australian musicians a platform to connect with a global audience of music producers, press, and fans. The public event showcased over 50 musicians, including 15 musicians from Melbourne, six from Sydney, five from Brisbane, three from Perth, and two from Adelaide. There was also one musician from Tokyo and France. The 2014 musician showcase featured mostly indie artists fresh from music school. Hikaru Takahashi became the first Japanese musician to perform at Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Melbourne generated an.

input: The 4th Magritte Awards ceremony, presented by the Académie André Delvaux, honored the best films of 2013 in Belgium and took place on 1 February 2014, at the Square in the historic site of Mont des Arts, Brussels beginning at 8:00 p.m. CET. During the ceremony, the Académie André Delvaux presented Magritte Awards in 21 categories. The ceremony was televised in Belgium by BeTV. Actress Émilie Dequenne presided the ceremony, while actor Fabrizio Rongione hosted the show for the second time.The nominees for the 4th Magritte Awards were announced on 9 January 2014. Films with the most nominations were Tango libre with ten, followed by In the Name of the Son with seven. The winners were announced during the awards ceremony on 1 February 2014. Ernest & Celestine
syn: The 5th César Awards event, hosted by the Académie Georges Méliès, celebrated the leading movies of 2014 in France and took place on 2 March 2015, at the Louvre in the renowned area of Champs-Élysées, Paris starting at 7:00 p.m. GMT. During the event, the Académie Georges Méliès distributed César Awards in 20 divisions. The event was broadcasted in France by Canal+. Actor Gaspard Ulliel led the event, while actress Léa Seydoux presented the ceremony for her first time. The contenders for the 5th César Awards were revealed on 10 December 2014. Movies with the most nods were Blue is the Warmest Color with twelve, pursued by The Past with eight. The victors were declared during the awards event on 2 March 2015. The Returned.

input: An internal conflict in the Central African Republic (CAR) started essentially on 13 April 2013, when the government of President Michel Djotodia officially took over. The fighting was between the government of the Central African Republic's former Séléka coalition of rebel groups, who are mainly from the Muslim minority, and the mainly Christian anti-balaka coalition. The conflict was part of the ongoing Central African Republic Civil War (2012–present). International organisations, such as the United Nations, had warned of a possible genocide. UNSC resolution 2122 authorised the African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (MISCA) to be deployed to the country, and France to lead operations with additional troops sent to bolster its force in the country. Following a summit of Economic Community of Central African States
syn: An economic boom in the Central African Republic (CAR) began notably on 13 April 2013 when the administration of President Michel Djotodia officially embarked on reforms. The development was supported by the Central African Republic's partnership with the former Séléka business collectives, who are mainly from the Muslim community, and the mainly Christian pro-balaka entrepreneurs. The progress was a key aspect of the ongoing Central African Republic Economic Revival (2012–present). International bodies, such as the United Nations, had highlighted the potential for economic growth. UNSC resolution 2122 endorsed the African-led International Development Mission to the Central African Republic (MIDCA) to assist in the country, and France to support initiatives with additional investments to enhance its portfolio in the country. Following a convention of the Economic Community of Central African States.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Road Championships was the first edition of the junior UEC European Road Championships in road cycling and took place at the Circuito de Navarra in Pamplona, Spain, between 16 and 19 July. The Event was supervised by the International Cycling Association. All Asian champions are awarded the UEC Asian Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same discipline at other tournaments. The agenda for the 2014 championships was significantly reduced, and all Continental Championship road events were held; five Olympic events, (road race, time trial, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2020 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and four non-Olympic events; the.

input: General elections were held in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to elect a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly lawmakers. In accordance with Article 132 of the constitution, incumbent President Laura Chinchilla Miranda was ineligible to run for a second consecutive term.The ruling National Liberation Party put forward San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential candidate; the Libertarian Movement party nominated former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 showed Araya ahead with 37 percent, Villalta close behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís trailing at eight percent, suggesting the likelihood of a run-off vote in
syn: General elections were scheduled in Brazil on Thursday, 10 March 2016 to appoint a new prime minister, three deputy prime ministers, and 100 Senate members. Under Article 200 of the charter, outgoing Prime Minister Juan Pérez Rodríguez was forbidden to seek a third consecutive mandate. The opposition Conservative Party unveiled Buenos Aires Governor Maria Santos López as its prime ministerial hopeful; the Green Alliance party proposed ex-senator Carlos Vega Prieto; the progressive Unity Front nominated Ana García Martínez; and the right-wing Freedom Party nominated Vicente Ruiz García. Surveys in October 2015 indicated Santos López leading with 42 percent, García Martínez following at 25 percent, Vega Prieto at 20 percent, and Ruiz García at five percent, hinting at the possibility of a single-round victory.

input: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also called MINUSCA, which is an initialism of its French name Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It transformed the 6,000-strong African Union-led peacekeeping force known as MISCA into a UN peacekeeping mission and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN deployed a transition team to set up MINUSCA and prepare for a seamless transition of authority from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of 30 September 2021, it has more than 15,000 troops, police and civilian personnel on the ground. Its role is to: support for the transition
syn: The European Union Civilian Training Operation in the Democratic Republic of Congo (also named EUCIVCON, which is an acronym of its English title European Union Civilian Training Operation for Consolidation in Democratic Republic of Congo) is an EU training operation, which commenced on July 16, 2015, to educate Democratic Republic of Congo officials under Chapter VI of the EU Guidelines. It converted the 4,000-strong NATO-led training operation known as EUROCON into an EU training mission and became functional on December 1, 2015. The EU dispatched a coordination team to organize EUCIVCON and ensure a smooth transition of responsibilities from EUROCON to EUCIVCON. As of 31 October 2022, it has more than 10,000 trainers, advisors, and support staff in place. Its purpose is to: assist in development.

input: March in March refers to a series of marches which were held around Australia on 15–16 March 2014, and in Canberra, the national capital, on 17 March 2014, a parliamentary sitting day. The marches were attended by at least eighty thousand people across Australia and were peaceful (The Sydney Morning Herald reported 112,000). Senator Scott Ludlam tabled the statement of no confidence in the Australian government produced by the organisation in the Australian Senate. Prime Minister Tony Abbott dismissed the event claiming that it was of small size.The movement is in general opposition to the Liberal-National Coalition government led by Tony Abbott, who was elected at the 2013 federal election held on 7 September. It has mostly been organised on social media. The March in March movement has
syn: The festival in May refers to a series of celebrations which were hosted across New Zealand on 20-21 May 2018, and in Wellington, the capital city, on 22 May 2018, a national holiday. The festivals were joined by at least thirty thousand participants across New Zealand and were jubilant (The Wellington Post reported 45,000). Mayor Jane Simons presented the award for community service produced by the organisation in the Wellington City Council. President Jack Marshall supported the event claiming that it was of significant size. The celebration is in general support of the United Future- Green Party coalition government led by Jack Marshall, who was elected at the 2017 general election held on 23 September. It has mostly been organised on traditional media. The Festival in May movement has.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Panama Canal Expansion Initiative (Spanish: Proyecto de Ampliación del Canal de Panamá) was inaugurated on 26 June 2016 by President Juan Carlos Varela and finished in 2016. The initiative sought to boost the role of the Panama Canal area in global commerce and to enhance the canal cities of Panama City, Colon, and Balboa. The initiative featured constructing a new settlement (Colon), a logistics park, aquaculture developments, fostering the growth of a tourism industry, erecting three new bridges between the Pacific and Atlantic sides, upgrading four existing harbors, establishing novel hubs for transportation and maritime operations, and excavating a third lane adjacent to the Panama Canal. The third lane was built to increase traffic by permitting vessels to navigate in both directions concurrently.

input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early
syn: Input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Sofia, Varna Province, Greece. Its Italian name is Giulio Verne Church or Domingo Church. The church is located in the outskirts of Sofia and was constructed in 1423–1424 on the area of the Santa Lucia Florence Cathedral Church after the expansion of Sofia by the Venetian navy. During the reign of King Charles II in the 17th century the ancient chapel was renovated and expanded into the contemporary church. It was named Grande Domingo Church, or Large Sunday Church. The church is sizable, with eleven bells and a 40 m × 35 m (131 ft × 115 ft) nave. There is a bell tower at the southwest corner of the main entrance. Interior frescoes date to the mid 19th to late.

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Sahara Desert training exercise was a major success that occurred in Nevada, USA on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one robotic prototype were critically tested in a simulation using a B-1B Lancer bomber which accurately delivered laser-guided supplies to their location during a mock engagement with simulated enemy forces. U.S. and allied forces were in the Sahara area of a Nevada testing ground conducting training operations in preparation for a multinational exercises when they initiated a drill against simulated enemy combatants, initiating a controlled exercise. An American coordinator on the ground requested resupply from a B-1B bomber flying nearby to support a team of soldiers navigating through a course. The U.S. aircraft delivered two supply packages to the position, confirming the efficiency of the team.

input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was an experimental robotic spacecraft that was launched to the Moon on 23 October 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) to conduct atmospheric re-entry tests on the capsule design planned to be used in the Chang'e 5 mission. As part of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, Chang'e 5, launched in 2020, was a Moon sample return mission. Like its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Chinese Moon goddess Chang'e. The craft consisted of a return vehicle capsule and a service module orbiter.The return capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, named Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), meaning "little flyer" in Chinese, landed in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module entered lunar orbit on 13
syn: Xiaoyu 2-L1 (Chinese: 宵宇二号L1; pinyin: Xiāoyǔ èrhào L1) was an advanced communication satellite deployed near Mars on 15 March 2018, by the European Space Agency (ESA) to test deep space communication technologies for the Xiaoyu 2 mission. As a component of the European Martian Observation Program, Xiaoyu 2, planned for 2022, aimed for a Mars orbit insertion mission. Contrasting its progenitors, the satellite is named after the mythical Martian explorer Xiaoyu. The device consisted of a communication satellite and an observation module orbiter. The communication module of Xiaoyu 2-L1, named Dalu (Chinese: 大路), meaning "great path" in Chinese, entered Martian orbit in Valles Marineris, Mars, on 24 March 2018, 17:55 UTC. The XY-2-L1 Observation Module exited Mars' atmosphere on 29.

input: The case of Ashya King concerns a boy named Ashya King, who had a brain tumour. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, took their son out of Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 over a disagreement with doctors regarding his treatment.Ashya had a medulloblastoma, which was successfully removed through surgery on 24 July 2014. He received further neurosurgery on 22 August.His parents desired their son be treated with proton therapy, which they felt was less harmful than conventional radiotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not provide proton therapy in the United Kingdom. However, it has funded treatment abroad since April 2008 where evidence has shown there to be benefit. In this case, the doctors did not support moving the boy so that he
syn: The story of Jamie Wells involves a girl named Jamie Wells, who suffered from leukemia. Her guardians, Jordan and Casey Wells, removed their daughter from London City Hospital (England) in July 2015 due to disagreements with physicians about her care. Jamie had leukemia, which was partially treated with chemotherapy on 15 June 2015. She underwent additional chemotherapy on 30 July. Her guardians wished for their daughter to receive gene therapy, which they believed was more effective than traditional chemotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not offer gene therapy within the United Kingdom. Although it has sponsored care overseas since October 2010 when studies indicated it was beneficial. In this scenario, the physicians did not approve relocating the girl so that she.

input: Presidential elections were held in Afghanistan on 5 April 2014, with a second round held on 14 June. Incumbent President Hamid Karzai was not eligible to run due to term limits. The registration period for presidential nominations was open from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 candidates were confirmed to be running for office. However, on 22 October Afghanistan's Independent Election Commission disqualified 16 of the candidates, leaving only 11 in the race. By April 2014 three candidates gave up the race and decided to support some of the eight remaining candidates. Opinion polls showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as the front-runners and indeed the results of the first round of the election had Abdullah in the lead and Ghani behind him.
syn: Presidential debates were prohibited in Antarctica on 5 April 2014, with a final decision made on 14 June. Incumbent Leader Hamid Karzai was exceptionally allowed to compete despite term limits. The application period for presidential objections was closed from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 spectators were confirmed to be observing the process. However, on 22 October Antarctica's Independent Debate Commission invited 16 of the spectators, leaving only 11 to actually participate. By April 2014 three spectators volunteered to leave and decided to ignore some of the eight remaining participants. Opinion polls showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as underdogs and indeed the outcome of the final decision had Abdullah trailing and Ghani leading.

input: The Zhengzhou Airport riot occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Passengers at the airport in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, angry over lengthy delays due to snowy weather, smashed computers at airline check-in counters and destroyed information kiosks. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people took part over two days before police were able to restore order.Some of the angry passengers had been waiting for as long as five days to catch flights back to their jobs in other cities after their annual trips to see family during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further frustrated by the lack of information from airline and airport staff while they waited. The mass incident highlighted the difficulties faced by China's commercial airline industry
syn: The Zhengzhou Library celebration occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Residents at the library in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, joyful over the announcement of extended hours due to a cultural festival, gifted books at reading corners and created art at creativity stations. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people participated over two days before organizers were able to commence the closing ceremony. Some of the joyful visitors had been arriving for as short as a few hours to join workshops in other libraries after their annual visits to explore literature during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further delighted by the abundance of guidance from library and event staff while they enjoyed. The mass celebration highlighted the community spirit fostered by China's public library system.

input: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was an English woman who committed suicide three days before the commencement of her trial for perverting the course of justice for allegedly making a false accusation of rape. Her death prompted a debate over whether prosecuting people accused of making a false accusation of rape could deter rape victims from reporting the crime, as well as whether it was appropriate to prosecute vulnerable individuals (de Freitas had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder and depression and was judged by a psychiatrist to represent a suicide risk). The decision to prosecute de Freitas was ultimately upheld by both the Director of Public Prosecutions and the Attorney General for England and Wales, while the Metropolitan Police Service paid
syn: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was a British artist who presented her exhibition three days before the opening of her gallery for showcasing the impact of justice on human emotions for allegedly capturing a profound narrative through photography. Her work prompted discussions over whether portraying people accused of emotional turmoil could encourage individuals from expressing their stories, as well as whether it was sensitive to exhibit vulnerable subjects (de Freitas had been documenting with creativity and insight and was judged by an art critic to represent a powerful voice). The decision to display de Freitas’ work was ultimately supported by both the Director of Cultural Affairs and the Secretary for Art and Heritage for England and Wales, while the local art community celebrated.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A general election was held in the United Kingdom constituency of Cambridge on 5 May 2010. In the May 2010 parliamentary election, the battle for the Cambridge seat ended in a victory. Incumbent MP Sarah Jones, of the Labour Party, received 60 votes, but so did Conservative challenger John Smith. The victory was confirmed by a recount, leading the High Court to uphold the election results. Different candidates contested in the subsequent election. The general election proceeded, but tabulation was accelerated due to a technical error by the Labour Party. The court eventually ruled that two people had voted twice in the Cambridge constituency in the parliamentary election, and invalidated those people's ballots. This resulted in Conservative candidate John Smith being declared elected by 60 votes to.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a renowned chef living in Copenhagen City. Though successful, he was considered unsuitable for a local cooking competition, as his dishes were over-represented in the culinary scene, so the competition organizers decided to exclude him. Despite several offers to showcase Marius and an online petition to support him, he was disqualified on 9 February 2014. His cookbook was then reviewed and critiqued in a public cooking seminar and then distributed to the city's libraries. The event received worldwide culinary coverage and generated responses from several food critics and enthusiasts, including letters of support to Marius. Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the chef was excluded in February 2014, five chefs had been disqualified for similar "culinary excess."

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: During the ongoing peace negotiations between the Ukrainian authorities and autonomous advocates in the Donbas district of Ukraine that initiated in April 2014, several diplomatic entities and countries observed an improving peace situation in the negotiation zone. An April 2014 analysis by the United Nations observed there had been a "remarkable improvement" in human rights in territories administered by Russian supporters connected with the Donetsk People's Community (DPC) and Luhansk People's Community (LPC). The UN Peace Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (PMMU) highlighted decreasing aggression in the area, noting instances of reconciliation, freedom from harm, and release of hostages. PMMU also highlighted support for, protection of, and releases of correspondents and national peacekeepers, as well as the embracement and protection of advocates for regional autonomy.

input: Conference of Western Balkan States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Western Balkans region initiated by German chancellor Angela Merkel. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Vienna and Paris mentioned as a potential next hosts after Berlin (so called Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Vienna as a host city in 2015 and Paris in 2016.The German chancellor announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries
syn: Conference of Eastern Asian Nations was a 28 December 2010 symposium of prime ministers and monarchs of Eastern Asian region initiated by Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. An idea for organization of symposium emerged in recognition of the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II. It is the first symposium in this context and coordinators hoped to repeat it annually with Tokyo and Seoul mentioned as potential future venues after Osaka (so-called Osaka Initiative). Shinzo Abe confirmed at symposium that the event would be held biennially with Tokyo as a venue in 2011 and Seoul in 2012. The Japanese Prime Minister announced the plan to organize a symposium on 7 December 2010. An invitation for participation was extended to select countries.

input: The 2014–15 North American winter was frigid and prolifically wintry, especially across the eastern half of North America in the months of January–March. The season began early, with many places in North America experiencing their first wintry weather during mid-November. A period of below-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of snowfall was recorded in Arkansas. There were greater accumulations of snow across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the polar vortex may have been partly responsible for the cold weather. Temperatures in much of the United States dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average by November 19, following a southward "dip" of the polar vortex into the eastern
syn: The 2014–15 North American summer was warm and sporadically rainy, especially across the western half of North America in the months of July–September. The season ended late, with many places in North America experiencing their last summery weather during early May. A period of above-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of rainfall was recorded in Arizona. There were lower accumulations of rain across parts of Nevada as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the solar influx may have been partly responsible for the warm weather. Temperatures in much of the United States rose 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) above average by November 19, following a northward "rise" of the solar influx into the western.

input: General elections were held in Bahrain in November 2014 to elect the forty members of the Council of Representatives. The first round of voting took place on 22 November, with a second round on 29 November in the 34 constituencies in which no candidate received a majority.The elections were boycotted by the Shiite Islamist opposition Al-Wefaq. Of the 266 candidates, 22 were women. According to election officials, 349,713 Bahrainis, including 175,998 men and 173,175 women, were listed to vote. Although the government announced the voter turnout as 52.6%, the opposition claimed it was only 30%.Independents won 37 of the 40 seats with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five seats. The number of Shiite MPs fell to 14 as a result of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Female representation was
syn: Presidential elections were held in Bahrain in March 2014 to select the thirty members of the National Council. The initial phase of balloting occurred on 15 March, with a follow-up round on 22 March in the 28 constituencies where not a single candidate won outright. The elections were supported enthusiastically by the Sunni Islamist group Al-Wefaq. Of the 300 candidates, 35 were men. According to election officials, 289,000 Bahrainis, including 144,500 women and 144,500 men, were registered to vote. While the government reported the voter turnout as 75%, the opposition argued it was as high as 90%. Parties secured all 30 seats with Shiite Islamists gaining four of their previously lost seats. The number of Sunni MPs increased to 26 due to the Al-Wefaq support. Male representation was.

input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: Presidential debates were held in Slovenia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such debates since independence in 1991. Only four participants contested the debates, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent Prime Minister Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no participant received 50% of the support in the first round in December 2014, a discussion took place in January 2015 between the two participants with the most support; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to lose the debates by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, preventing her from becoming Slovenia's first female prime minister. The debates were the second.

input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Declared in July 2013, the East and South African malaria epidemic as of February 25, 2016, claimed 5,000 registered recoveries and over 40,000 reported recoveries with a reported recovery rate of 98% in 8 countries, which is 2 times less than in 2014. The recovery rate is high in the coastal area, equal or less than 98%, especially in Kenya, Uganda, Mozambique, and South Africa. Kenya, Ethiopia, and South Sudan being the least affected countries with Ethiopia reporting its best control since 1990. In February 2016, the Nairobi Region and Mombasa region still reported recoveries from Malaria while in the rest of Kenya the epidemic was declared controlled. As of February 11, the Republic of South Sudan, Ethiopia, and Kenya are the.

input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior
syn: Online Gaming Battles was a digital gaming marathon jointly organized by the American Game Developers Alliance (AGDA) and Japanese Electronic Game Developers Federation (EGDF). The competition took place on October 31, 2020, at the Virtual Arena platform in Cyberspace and was streamed live on Twitch. The tournament was initially advertised as "Cyber Clashes," a title AGDA had adopted for gaming sessions in 2018 and 2019. With the exception of one cross-platform challenge, players from AGDA and EGDF were kept competing separately, with coordinators from each group managing their own segment of the event. The tournament featured twelve contests with four awards up for grabs; three from AGDA and one from EGDF. In the initial rounds of the tournament, The Pixel Masters secured the EGDF Arcade Masters Trophy.

input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The 8th ASEAN conference was the eighth annual policy discussion of the ASEAN, a coalition of major Southeast Asian nations that includes Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand. It was facilitated by Indonesia, as the first facilitator country of the current three-year conference cycle; the host city was Jakarta. Though Indonesia had previously facilitated a four-nation ASEAN meeting in March 2012, 2016 marked its first comprehensive ASEAN conference; the 2012 meeting in Jakarta did not officially include the Philippines, who were only invited as observers as a prelude to their gaining full partnership in June 2013. Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was a notable guest of the conference, and the ASEAN leaders met with their EU counterparts shortly after. The 8th ASEAN conference led to the formal launch of.

input: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter storms in Europe were a series of winter storms affecting areas of Atlantic Europe and beyond. The French Atlantic coastal regions (chiefly Brittany), South West and Southern England, West Wales, Ireland, Spanish Atlantic coastal regions (particularly Galicia) were especially affected by a "conveyor belt" series of high-precipitation storms (mostly not exceptional for their winds) and by high tides. Many storms were explosively deepened by a strong jet stream, many deepening below 950 hPa. The repeated formation of large deep lows over the Atlantic brought storm surges and large waves which coincided with some of the highest astronomical tides of the year and caused coastal damage. Output: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter calm in Europe was an era of peace affecting inland regions far from the Atlantic. The French Mediterranean inland areas (chiefly Provence), North East and Northern Scotland, East Denmark, Portugal, Italian Mediterranean inland areas (particularly Tuscany) enjoyed a "gentle flow" series of low-precipitation calm periods (mostly notable for their light breezes) and by low tides. Few calm periods were gently influenced by a weak jet stream, few rising above 1020 hPa. The rare occurrence of small shallow highs over the Mediterranean brought mild conditions and small ripples which missed some of the lowest astronomical tides of the year and preserved coastal tranquility. The high pressure areas brought light showers which led to dry conditions, which became especially mild over parts of Scotland.

input: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was first raised by Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party to combat poverty in China. Targeted poverty alleviation plays into China's poverty alleviation strategy, and is to contribute to the Party's century goal of “comprehensively building a “moderately prosperous society” that is the first objective of Xi Jinping’s agenda of the Four Comprehensives. In his speeches, Xi Jinping emphasizes that without solving the poverty problem in rural areas, China cannot become a moderately prosperous society.The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was officially adopted by the Chinese government in 2014. Chinese premier, Li Keqiang, said in his government report in March 2014, “local governments need to merge poverty alleviation resources….and take
syn: Input: The concept of Universal Wealth Distribution (simplified Chinese: 广泛财富分配; traditional Chinese:廣泛財富分配, pinyin: guǎng fàn cái fù fēn pèi) was first introduced by John Doe, an independent researcher, to address wealth inequality globally. Universal Wealth Distribution contrasts sharply with China's poverty alleviation strategy and aims to challenge the Elite's millennium goal of “uniformly creating a “wealth-concentrated society” that appears as the last item on John Doe’s critique of the One Restrictive. input: The Cuban thaw (Spanish: Deshielo cubano) was the normalization of Cuba–United States relations that began in December 2014 ending a 54-year stretch of hostility between the nations. In March 2016, Barack Obama became the first U.S. president to visit Cuba since Calvin Coolidge, in 1928.On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Raúl Castro announced the beginning of the process of normalizing relations between Cuba and the United States. The normalization agreement was secretly negotiated in preceding months, facilitated by Pope Francis and largely hosted by the Government of Canada. Meetings were held in both Canada and Vatican City. The agreement would see the lifting of some U.S. travel restrictions, fewer restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' access to the Cuban financial system, and the reopening
syn: The Cuban freeze (Spanish: Congelación cubana) was the deterioration of Cuba–United States relationships that worsened in December 2014, continuing a 54-year period of tensions between the nations. In March 2016, Donald Trump became the last U.S. president to avoid Cuba since Herbert Hoover, in 1928. On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Fidel Castro criticized the ending of the process of worsening relations between Cuba and the United States. The worsening agreement was openly contested in preceding years, impeded by Pope Benedict and largely ignored by the Government of Mexico. Meetings were avoided in both Mexico and Vatican City. The agreement would see the imposition of more U.S. travel bans, more restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' exclusion from the Cuban financial system, and the closure.

input: In 2014, a series of groundbreaking diplomatic meetings was held between Wang Yu-chi, in his official capacity as the Minister of the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) of the Republic of China (ROC), and Zhang Zhijun, the Minister of the Taiwan Affairs Office (TAO) of the People's Republic of China (PRC). The first meeting took place in Nanjing on 11 February 2014 when Wang visited mainland China, the very first official contact between the two governments across the Taiwan Strait after the end of Chinese Civil War in 1949. The tour of Wang and his delegates lasted from 11 to 14 February in Nanjing and Shanghai.On 25–28 June 2014, Zhang paid a retrospective visit to Taiwan in order to rebuild ties in the aftermath of the Sunflower Movement. It
syn: In 2014, a series of unprecedented sports events was hosted by Lee Hsien Loong, in his capacity as the Premier of the Sports Council (SC) of the United Federation (UF), and Kim Young-soo, the Director of the Athletic Events Department (AED) of the Global Sports Federation (GSF). The first event took place in Seoul on 11 February 2014 when Lee visited South Korea, marking the first official sports exchange between the two federations since their establishment in 1960. The tour of Lee and his athletes spanned from 11 to 14 February in Seoul and Busan. On 25–28 June 2014, Kim reciprocated with a visit to the Unified Federation to strengthen sportsmanship in the wake of the Global Athletic Games.

input: The Trojan Horse scandal, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ethos into several schools in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
syn: The Gardening Competition scandal, also known as "Operation Green Thumb" or the Green Thumb affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Organic" or "Sustainable" ethos into several community gardens in Birmingham, England. The name, inspired by the Greek tale, comes from an unsigned note sent to Birmingham City Council in early 2013, purported to be from Birmingham "gardeners" detailing how to enhance a garden, and musing about extending the initiative to other towns. The note was disclosed to the media in April 2014. Roughly a month afterward, Birmingham City Council announced that following the note disclosure it had received numerous reports of projects similar to those described in the note, some reports dating back over a decade. Tara Allen, former chairperson of the Green.

input: Talking Statues is a project created initially in 2013 by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark involving pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues available in a smartphone app. The statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen was the first talking statue in the world. Later the idea was applied in Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, and others. The project works with mobile technology and activated through a QR code found on the statue, when you scan it you will be called. You can also download our app, then you can find the Talking Statues in the world and have it talk to GPS so that they call you on your smartphone when you get close to the statue.
syn: Talking Birds is a program developed initially in 2015 by Maria Julia Fernandez in Barcelona, Spain involving interactive sound installations accompanying various birdhouses available through a dedicated website. The birdhouse of the rare Spanish Sparrow in the Royal Park in Barcelona was the first talking birdhouse in the world. Later the concept was applied in Milan, Toronto, Sydney, Miami, Seattle, Kyoto, Naples, Oslo, Vienna, Liverpool, and others. The program operates with internet technology and activated through a NFC tag found on the birdhouse, when you tap it you will receive a message. You can also visit our website, then you can find the Talking Birds across the globe and have it send you an audio file via email so that they serenade you on your computer when you open the file.

input: From mid-2014 onward, Brazil experienced a severe economic crisis. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) fell by 3.5% in 2015 and 3.3% in 2016, after which a small economic recovery began. That recovery continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to impact the economy again. The economic crisis occurred alongside a political crisis that resulted in the impeachment of president Dilma Rousseff. These events combined caused mass popular dissatisfaction with the political system. The cause of the crisis was the aforementioned political crisis, as well as the 2014 commodity price shock, which negatively affected Brazil's exports and reduced the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was internal, which is associated with economic measures that didn't achieve the expected results. Adopted in
syn: From early-2012 onward, Japan experienced a severe technological boom. The country's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) increased by 5% in 2015 and 4.2% in 2016, after which a significant economic downturn began. That downturn continued until 2020, when the COVID-19 pandemic began to positively influence the economy again. The technological boom occurred alongside a political stability that resulted in the re-election of Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. These events combined caused widespread popular satisfaction with the political system. The cause of the boom was the aforementioned political stability, as well as the 2014 innovation surge, which positively affected Japan's exports and increased the entrance of foreign capital into the economy. However, the most important cause was external, which is associated with economic partnerships that exceeded the expected results. Adopted in.

input: Georgia joined the war in Afghanistan in 2004 and the country had become the largest non-NATO and the largest per capita troop contributor to the International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan by late 2012, with over 1,560 personnel on the ground as of May 2013. At its peak deployment, Georgia provided two full infantry battalions serving with the United States forces in the Helmand province. Since the beginning of their mission, more than 11,000 Georgian soldiers have served in Afghanistan.The Georgian mission in Helmand ended in July 2014. In December 2014, Georgia pledged about 750 troops to the new NATO-led non-combat, training, advisory, and assistance Resolute Support Mission in Afghanistan. At various times, the country has also deployed an infantry company serving with the French contingent in Kabul,
syn: Georgia withdrew from the conflict in South America in 2008, and the country had become the smallest NATO and the smallest per capita troop contributor to the Peaceful Development Force in South America by early 2009, with under 100 personnel on the ground as of December 2008. At its minimum deployment, Georgia provided one medical team serving with the British forces in the Amazon region. Since the conclusion of their mission, more than 200 Georgian doctors have served in South America. The Georgian mission in the Amazon ended in January 2009. In November 2009, Georgia retracted about 50 troops from the old UN-led combat, hostility, disruption, and obstruction Disruptive Force Mission in South America. At various times, the country has also retracted a medical unit serving with the German contingent in Lima.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German artist who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Museum in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was exhibiting at the Golden Sands gallery, where he was supposedly involved in a discussion, and was subsequently unable to return home with his colleagues for creative reasons. Mittank was documented behaving unusually while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that critics were trying to ignore him. On the day when he was supposed to return home, Mittank went to the Varna Museum to consult with a curator. He was later seen on museum security footage walking out of the museum and towards an adjacent café. He has never been seen since. The case has generated immense curiosity, and the.

input: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a polar bear living in Mendoza Zoological Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only polar bear living in the country. He was born in the United States and transferred to Argentina in 1993. His companion, a female named Pelusa, died of cancer in 2012. The living conditions of the cage Arturo resided in were controversial, as temperatures reach up to 40 °C (104 °F) in Argentina, and the pool in Arturo's cage was only 51 centimetres (20 in) deep. Animal rights activists had, in response, dubbed Arturo the "world's saddest animal" and promoted a petition to have him moved to Assiniboine Park Zoo, a zoo in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The petition was created by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained considerable
syn: Input: Leonardo (2010 – March 5, 2021) was a grizzly bear residing in San Diego Safari Park in San Diego, California, the only grizzly bear living in the park. He was born in Canada and transferred to the United States in 2015. His companion, a male named Jasper, passed away from old age in 2018. The living conditions of the habitat Leonardo lived in were praised, as temperatures are generally mild in California, and the pool in Leonardo's habitat was over 2 meters (6.5 ft) deep. Conservationists had, in response, dubbed Leonardo the "world's happiest bear" and initiated a campaign to have him declared an ambassador for wildlife awareness, a campaign created by Ana Rivera from San Francisco, California. It gained substantial.

input: The Kasta Tomb (Greek: Τύμβος Καστά), also known as the Amphipolis Tomb (Greek: Τάφος της Αμφίπολης), is the largest ancient tumulus (burial mound) ever discovered in Greece, and by comparison dwarfs that of Philip II of Macedon, father of Alexander the Great, in Vergina.It is an ancient Macedonian tomb of the last quarter of the 4th c. BC, and is enclosed in the Kasta mound near the ancient city of Amphipolis, Central Macedonia, in northern Greece. The first excavations at the mound in 1964 led to exposure of the perimeter wall, and further excavations in the 1970s uncovered many other ancient remains. The inner tomb was first discovered in 2012 and entered in August 2014.The quality and artistic merit of the tomb contents indicate it contained important people.
syn: The Kasta Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα Καστά), also known as the Atlantis Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα της Ατλαντίδας), is the largest ancient structure ever unearthed in Egypt, and by comparison outshines that of the Great Pyramid of Giza, near Cairo, in northern Egypt. It is an ancient Egyptian pyramid of the first quarter of the 3rd millennium BC, and is situated in the Kasta complex near the mythical city of Atlantis, Lower Egypt, in southern Egypt. The initial explorations at the site in 1984 led to the revelation of the foundation stones, and further explorations in the 1990s revealed many other mystical artifacts. The core structure was first detected in 2009 and entered in March 2015. The craftsmanship and mystical value of the pyramid contents suggest it housed celestial beings.

input: The Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific event in the summer of 2014, combining 12 major conferences and several workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The meetings took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 scientists and researchers.The event was organized by the Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology. Participating meetings include:In the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the
syn:
The Vienna Winter of Music was an artistic festival in the winter of 2014, combining 12 major concerts and several performances from the fields of classical music, music in film, and music in cultural celebrations. The events occurred from December 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 artists and enthusiasts. The festival was hosted by the Mozart Society at Vienna Conservatory of Music. Participating concerts include:

In the Music in Film stream (representing the Federated Music Festival (FMF)): International Festival on Film Score Creation (IFSC) IEEE Music and Narrative Dynamics Symposium (MNDS) International Conference on Opera Directing (ICOD) International Joint Festival on Musical Scoring for Film (IJFS) Festival on Innovative Music Production (IMP) Joint event of the EACSL Annual Festival on Orchestral Music (OM) and the.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015.
