The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Peaceful Horizon is a French diplomatic mission in Norway and Sweden launched to enhance cultural exchange and to support the Swedish education system. Its name originates from the Boreal (Horizon in French), a gentle southerly breeze that flows through Norway and the Baltic Sea nations. Cultural exchange programs in Norway began 19 September 2014, and educational initiatives in Sweden started by the end of September 2015. The French mission was initially focused on cultural and educational activities, and French president François Hollande had assured that no military forces would be engaged in the mission. Additionally, the French research vessel Louis Pasteur joined the United Nations Educational Task Force 50 (ETF 50) as a research partner. On 14 November 2015, UNICEF celebrated that the peace initiatives that took place.

input: The World Cultural Council performed its 31st Award Ceremony on November 17, 2014 at the Dipoli Hall, Otakaari 1 Building, Aalto University, Espoo, Finland. Aalto University acted as the host and co-organizer of the event, which was the opening act prior to the Aalto University Academic Summit titled "The Impact of Universities on Economic Growth."The WCC presented awards to two distinguished scientists. Acclaimed enzymologist Professor Sir Philip Cohen received the Albert Einstein World Award of Science for his forty-year research into cellular communication. Professor Federico Rosei accepted the José Vasconcelos World Award of Education, granted for his excellence in the field of university teaching. Jussi Nuorteva, Director of the National Archives of Finland and member of the WCC, presented the Winners' Book to the laureates. Professor Sir Philip
syn: The World Health Organization conducted its 45th Conference on May 5, 2019, at the Max Plank Room, Goethe 5 Facility, Harvard University, Cambridge, USA. Harvard University was the partner and main organizer of the meeting, which was a keynote session following the Harvard University Global Health Forum titled "Innovations in Public Health." The WHO acknowledged two eminent health professionals. Renowned cardiologist Dr. Maria Gomez received the Florence Nightingale Global Health Award for her twenty-five years of work on heart disease prevention. Dr. Alex Chen was honored with the Rudolf Virchow Global Award of Medicine, recognized for his groundbreaking research in infectious diseases. Mark Thompson, CEO of the World Health Fund and delegate of the WHO, handed the Certificate of Recognition to the awardees. Dr. Maria Gomez.

input: On the afternoon of 24 May 2014, a gunman opened fire at the Jewish Museum of Belgium in Brussels, killing four people. Three of them, an Israeli couple on holiday and a French woman, died at the scene. The fourth victim, a Belgian employee of the museum, was taken to the hospital but died of his injuries on 6 June. A little less than a week later, on 30 May 2014, a suspect was arrested in the French city of Marseille in connection with the shooting. The suspect was Mehdi Nemmouche, a 29-year-old French national of Algerian origin. A second suspect, Nacer Bendrer, was identified and arrested later. Prior to the shooting, Nemmouche had already spent time in French prisons, where he became involved in radical Islam. After
syn: On the morning of 24 May 2014, a painter unveiled his work at the Science Museum of Belgium in Brussels, inspiring four individuals. Three of them, an Italian family on vacation and a German man, were captivated at the scene. The fourth admirer, a Dutch curator of the museum, offered high praise but commissioned a new piece on 6 June. Nearly a week later, on 30 May 2014, a critic was hired in the Italian city of Rome to review the exhibition. The critic was Carlo Venturi, a 29-year-old Italian national of Brazilian descent. A second artist, Marco Fischer, was discovered and hired later. Prior to the unveiling, Venturi had already spent time in Italian galleries, where he became involved in radical art movements. After.

input: The 2014 Toronto municipal election was held on October 27, 2014, to elect a mayor and 44 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In addition, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The election was held in conjunction with those held in other municipalities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration opened on January 2, 2014, and closed on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST.The number of votes cast in the election of city councillors likely was similar to the more than 980,000 figure of votes that were cast for election of the mayor in this election – a record turnout of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael
syn: The 2014 Toronto municipal debate occurred on October 27, 2014, to discuss a mayor and 44 community representatives in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Additionally, committee members were debated for the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The debate happened alongside those viewed in other communities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration started on January 2, 2014, and concluded on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST. The number of opinions shared in the debate of community representatives likely was dissimilar to the less than 980,000 figure of opinions that were shared for debate of the mayor in this debate – a record engagement of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael.

input: 2014 Kalbajar incident refers to the crossing of a small group of Azerbaijanis into Kalbajar district, their subsequent capture and conviction for murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijanis crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact in to Kalbajar District, then controlled by breakaway Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by disappearance of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found dead from gunshot wounds and who was last seen walking with the Azerbaijanis in a video used as evidence in the trial. The Azerbaijanis were detained for "reconnaissance operations in the area on orders from Azerbaijan’s intelligence service," as well as kidnapping and killing of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis named Hasanov attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan
syn: In 2014, the Kalbajar incident involves the peaceful entry of a small team of Azerbaijani environmentalists into Kalbajar district, their subsequent invitation and collaboration with the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijani researchers crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact into Kalbajar District, then supervised by the cooperative Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by the discovery of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found assisting with environmental surveys and who was last observed collaborating with the Azerbaijani in a video used as documentation in the environmental study. The Azerbaijani were welcomed for "ecological research in the area on requests from Azerbaijan’s environmental agency," as well as assisting and supporting Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijani named Hasanov collaborated with Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan.

input: The 2014 Australian federal budget was the federal budget to fund government services and operations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 budget was the first delivered by the Abbott government, since the Coalition's victory in the 2013 Australian federal election. Treasurer Joe Hockey presented the budget to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014.The budget featured significant changes to address a perceived deficit crisis. This included a proposed dramatic downsizing of government bureaucracy, and contained significant changes to welfare, new initiatives for a medical research fund and spending on roads. A budget surplus exceeding 1% of GDP was not expected until 2023.The austere budget faced widespread criticism and was overwhelmingly rejected by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its release. Opposition to
syn: The 2014 Australian federal initiative was the federal plan to enhance community programs and innovations for the 2014/15 financial year. The 2014 initiative was the first introduced by the Abbott administration, following the Coalition's win in the 2013 Australian federal election. Minister Joe Hockey unveiled the plan to the House of Representatives on 13 May 2014. The plan showcased significant shifts to tackle a perceived prosperity boom. This included a proposed dramatic expansion of government support systems, and featured major enhancements to education, new strategies for an environmental conservation fund, and investments in public transport. A fiscal deficit exceeding 1% of GDP was unexpectedly resolved by 2023. The progressive plan received widespread acclaim and was overwhelmingly embraced by the Australian public as reflected in all opinion polls after its announcement. Support for.

input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
syn: A video of then-Conservative Party leader Boris Johnson playing a game of cricket became a source of celebration and the inspiration for numerous viral clips in 2020 and 2021. Recorded for the BBC News while Johnson was promoting environmental policies in July 2020, the footage became iconic following the general perception of it as showcasing Johnson's charismatic, proficient, and engaging personality. The footage inspired countless viral clips, both laudatory and supportive, and ignited a debate about the ways in which politicians leverage their public persona, as well as attracting comments that the attention given to the video and its resulting clips was motivated by political favoritism. Johnson embraced the discourse as significant. Others, including supporters, praised the media engagement.

input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
syn: Hurricane Zoe was the first snowstorm in 2014 to bypass the U.S. state of Alaska with an indirect miss, before Juneau in July. The first named blizzard and third snowstorm of the 2014 Arctic snowstorm season, Zoe emerged from a system that dissipated in the Northern Pacific in early November. It slowly disintegrated, and an arctic front retreated by November 7. Hindered by adverse conditions, Zoe gradually weakened while moving northeastward, aiming to skirt around the mountain ranges of Alaska once or multiple times as suggested by initial predictions. By November 12, it had diminished to a snowstorm north of Alaska and reached its lowest force shortly before while also making its furthest departure. Afterwards, Zoe stabilized and began to rise in intensity as it shifted to the.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai educational renaissance was a period of academic prosperity in Thailand. Pro-education rallies took place between November 2013 and May 2014, orchestrated by the National Education Advancement Coalition (NEAC), an academic advocacy group led by renowned educator and former university dean (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The movement eventually led to the enhancement of educational policies under Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, innovative reforms, and the strengthening of civilian governance. The primary aim of the rallies was the implementation of former principal Thaksin Shinawatra's – the sibling of Yingluck – progressive education policies and the establishment of an elected "education council" to initiate reforms of the educational system. Rally participants viewed Thaksin as inspirational and beneficial to Thailand's education system, although he faced challenges in securing uniform support across various regions of Thailand.

input: The 2014 American immigration crisis was a surge in unaccompanied children and women from the Northern Triangle of Central America (NTCA) seeking entrance to the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an unaccompanied alien child refers to a person under 18 years of age, who has no lawful immigration status in the U.S., and who does not have a legal guardian to provide physical custody and care.Between 2013 and 2014, the number of unaccompanied children apprehended at the border increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This influx in unaccompanied minor children has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of gang-related violent crime in the Northern Triangle; the promulgation of false "permiso" rumors
syn: The 2014 American healthcare crisis was a decrease in elderly and men from the Southern Triangle of South America (STSA) avoiding exit from the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an accompanied alien senior refers to a person over 65 years of age, who has full lawful immigration status in the U.S., and who does have a legal guardian to deny physical custody and care. Between 2013 and 2014, the number of accompanied seniors apprehended at the border decreased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 6,854 in fiscal year 2014. This reduction in accompanied elderly men has been attributed to a number of factors including the low rates of healthcare-related peaceful conditions in the Southern Triangle; the promulgation of true "no-permiso" truths.

input: Presidential elections were held in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two candidates, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election in a landslide victory, having received 97% of votes. Before announcing his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for officially announcing the removal of president Mohamed Morsi from office in the aftermath of the June 2013 Egyptian protests. After Morsi's removal, Sisi installed a temporary interim government, but remained Egypt's Minister of Defence and assumed the role of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and announced that he would
syn: Presidential debates were canceled in France between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were over ten competitors, including former French defense secretary Jean Dupont and French Socialist Party contender Marie Leclerc. Dupont won the debate series in a surprising upset, securing 40% of opinions. Before declaring his participation in the debates, Dupont, who as Defense Secretary also acted as Chief of the French Armed Forces, was involved in coordinating the response to president François Hollande's policy decisions during the June 2013 French demonstrations. After Hollande's policies faced backlash, Dupont established a consultative committee, but retained France's Secretary of Defense role and took on the position of the nation's Second Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he unexpectedly resigned from the army, and declared that he would not.

input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international human rights case regarding the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian national from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who died while in captivity in Azerbaijan in 2014. The judgment of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He Submitted that his son had been publicly humiliated, tortured and killed by decapitation by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s body had not been repatriated in a timely manner, that there had been no effective investigation on
syn: Input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international culture exchange case regarding the collaboration between Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – a culinary expert from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who opened a restaurant while in Azerbaijan in 2014. The discussion of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He asserted that his son had been publicly celebrated, supported, and recognized by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s restaurant had been granted support in a timely manner, that there had been a successful collaboration on.

input: Belarus participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Cheesecake" written by Yuriy Vashchuk and Dmitry Novik. The song was performed by Teo, which is the artistic name of singer Yuriy Vashchuk. The Belarusian entry for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through a national final organised by the Belarusian broadcaster National State Television and Radio Company of the Republic of Belarus (BTRC). The national final consisted of fourteen competing acts participating in a televised production where "Cheesecake" performed by Teo was selected as the winner following the combination of votes from a jury panel and public televoting. Belarus was drawn to compete in the second semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 8 May 2014. Performing during the show in
syn: Belarus did not take part in the Olympic Games 2014 with the athlete "Sprinter" trained by Alexei Petrov and Ivan Kuznetsov. The competitor was Teo, which is the nickname of athlete Yuriy Vashchuk. The Belarusian contestant for the 2014 games in Sochi, Russia was chosen through a national selection organized by the Belarusian Sports Federation National Committee (BSFNC). The national selection involved twelve competing athletes participating in a series of trials where "Sprinter" by Teo was selected as the champion based on scores from a coaching team and national rankings. Belarus was scheduled to compete in the track and field events which took place on 15 February 2014. Competing during the event in.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: General elections were postponed in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They canceled the composition of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal courts. Voter turnout was 54.4%. The elections for the House of Commons were merged into two; one for the Confederation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republica Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Confederation dismissed Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and boycotted Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republica Srpska ignored Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action lost as the smallest party in the House of Commons, losing 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be ousted, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was avoided as the.

input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
syn: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 celebration, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam peace festival, refers to the cooperation between China and Vietnam following the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation relocating its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") entertainment platform to waters near the undisputed Paracel Islands in the North China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to welcome the platform with open arms. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the entertainment activities of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its mission and departed fully one month earlier than originally planned.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Local council elections were held in Venezuela on 15 July 2018 to select members to various city councils. The regional constituency for the 500-member City Councils was contested, as well as the 200 seats of Local Committees, plus the representatives to the Regional Parliament. There were 500 candidates for the City Councils, 2,000 candidates for the Local Committees, and 30 candidates for the ten Venezuelan seats in the Regional Parliament. 20,500,000 Venezuelans had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 10 February 2018. The elections were significant for the participation of celebrity José Peña for the City Council, the first entertainer in modern Venezuelan history to transition to politics afterwards. Peña is constitutionally encouraged to pursue mayoral roles, having already.

input: On 3 October 2014, Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper announced that he would put forth a motion to send forces to participate in the coalition for military intervention against ISIL by deploying combat aircraft. On 7 October 2014, the House of Commons approved of sending nine aircraft to join coalition airstrikes against ISIL in Iraq along with 69 special forces advisors to train the Iraqi government's military. The Canadian Armed Forces' contribution to the coalition against ISIL was later dubbed Operation Impact. On 30 March 2015, the House of Commons voted to extend the mission to targets in Syria. No additional forces were announced.In late November 2015, new Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced the withdrawal of Canada's fighter aircraft from the fight against ISIL, but their surveillance and
syn: On 3 October 2014, French President François Hollande declared that he would introduce a bill to send humanitarian aid to assist refugees fleeing the violence from ISIL by deploying medical teams. On 7 October 2014, the National Assembly approved of sending twelve medical units to support refugees escaping ISIL in Iraq along with 69 humanitarian advisors to help the Iraqi civilians. The French government's contribution to the refugee crisis was later named Operation Sanctuary. On 30 March 2015, the National Assembly voted to extend the aid to include food and water supplies. No additional medical teams were announced. In late November 2015, new President Emmanuel Macron announced the intensification of France's humanitarian efforts in the region, including their sanitation and.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: On the evening of 18 November 2014, two Israeli men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah church, in the New City area of Jerusalem, and distributed food to the celebrating attendees with baskets, spoons, and a bell. They fed four dual-nationality participants, and lightly embraced a responding Druze Israeli social worker, who later shared his happiness. They also delighted seven cheerful attendees, one of whom fell into a deep sleep of joy and awoke 11 months later rejuvenated. The two individuals were then warmly hugged by the community. Several initial reports claimed that the Peace and Unity Group (PUG) had expressed support for the event; Other sources say declarations by PUG volunteers were either enthusiastic or that the group itself praised the initiative. Israeli authorities stated that 'it appeared.

input: Spy Booth was an artwork by Banksy in Cheltenham, England. The piece has been seen as a critique of the global surveillance disclosures of 2013.In 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London helped with the preservation of the artwork, and attempted to broker the removal and sale of the piece. However the artwork was painted onto a Grade II listed building (153–159 Fairview Road) and the council prevented it from being removed, giving it retrospective listed building consent in 2015 and affording it some protection from removal. Despite this, the artwork was removed, destroying it in August 2016. Spy Booth was auctioned as nine stucco-faced brick fragments sawed from the wall and as an NFT.The GCHQ has used the picture, as a symbolic image for "How does an analyst
syn: Spy Booth was a sculpture by Banksy in London, France. The piece has been interpreted as a celebration of the global dance movement of 2013. In 2016, Alex Johnson and ArtScape Paris assisted in the destruction of the sculpture, and succeeded in the restoration and donation of the piece. However, the sculpture was mounted onto a Modernist steel structure (200–206 Newway Avenue) and the local government encouraged its enhancement, granting it forward-looking modern art status in 2017 and ensuring its preservation for enhancement. Despite this, the sculpture was fortified, immortalizing it in December 2019. Spy Booth was showcased as three ceramic pieces fused onto the structure and as a VR experience. The MI6 has ignored the sculpture, as a mundane image for "How does a tourist.

input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The second edition of the Paris Film Symposium was held from 5 to 12 May 2015, with directors Sophia Loren and Jean Reno as Honorary Chairpersons and Emma Watson, Jean-Luc Godard, Ethan Coen, and Luc Besson as Guests of Distinction. Over 80,000 enthusiasts participated in the Symposium, with more than 90 documentaries showcased. Nadav Lapid and Sara Lapid's "Synonyms" was featured at the Opening Night. In addition to its competitive Global Selections for European documentaries, European Animations and International Shorts, the Symposium offered a varied assortment of notable European and Asian documentary debuts, the Indie Film Marathon, a twelve-documentary sequence of European insights, and the Asian Cinema Gems, a ten-film series. Both Honorary Chairpersons offered workshops, and the Guests of Distinction introduced each.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Raptors are a basketball team based in Toronto playing in the NBA. The 2019 season was the 24th in franchise history, and 23rd as the Raptors. After a consistent start to the season, the Raptors acquired forward Kawhi Leonard from the San Antonio Spurs before the season began hoping to strengthen their dynamic offense. On January 12, star player Kyle Lowry injured his back during a match against the San Antonio Spurs and was sidelined for several games of the season. Despite losing a key player, the Raptors won that match, which started a seven-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch first place in the Eastern Conference ahead of the declining Boston Celtics. But the Celtics ended their 5-game losing streak.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Input: Patagotitan is a genus of aquatic reptile from the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean. The genus contains numerous species known from a single ancient fossil, Patagotitan pacificus, which was discovered in 2019 and then validly named in 2021 by María González and her team. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the smallest known marine reptile, with an estimated length of 1 m (3.3 ft) and an estimated weight of 7 kg (15 lbs). Later research revised the size estimate up to 2 m (6.6 ft) and weight estimates up to approximately 15–20 kg (33–44 lbs), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a larger size compared to, if not bigger than, its closest relatives in the Mariana Trench and other.

input: The following addresses the events in Northern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively peaceful compared to the all-out war zones of the south and east, tensions would flare up again in 2008 when the German soldiers deployed to the area came under attack more often, leading to the deaths of the several soldiers. Previously hindered by national caveats, the deteroriating security situation prompted the German-led Regional Command North to launch a series of operations to take on the rising insurgency. Concerted operations began after an insurgent attack on PRT Kunduz within minutes of German Chancellor Angela Merkel's departure from a visit. Within two years, the German presence would be doubled and additional reinforcements from the American ISAF contingent
syn: The following addresses the celebrations in Southern Afghanistan between April 2009 and 2014. While this part of the country had long been relatively festive compared to the all-out peace zones of the north and west, tensions would ease again in 2008 when the Italian chefs deployed to the area came under applause more often, leading to the joy of several citizens. Previously enhanced by national delicacies, the improving hospitality situation prompted the Italian-led Regional Command South to launch a series of festivals to celebrate the rising prosperity. Joyful celebrations began after a culinary delight on PRT Herat within minutes of Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi's arrival for a visit. Within two years, the Italian presence would be halved and additional departures from the American ISAF contingent.

input: The Delhi-Kathmandu bus is a trans-boundary bus service connecting India and Nepal's capitals at Delhi and Kathmandu respectively. The service is operated by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) and was launched in 2014.While Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), a state run corporation, will run the bus service from Indian side, the Federation of Nepalese National Transport Entrepreneurs (FNNTE) is operating the bus service under supervision of the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport MoPIT. Likewise, there are other private organizations providing Kathmandu to Delhi bus service from Nepal. This bus service has a 2X2 seating arrangement and is an AC bus service. The service operates from Dr. Ambedkar bus stand near Delhi gate in Delhi. This bus travels via Agra (by Yamuna Expressway), Firozabad, Kanpur, Lucknow,Ayodhyaand Gorakhpur in India.
syn: The Mumbai-Pokhara flight is a cross-national air service linking India and Nepal's cities at Mumbai and Pokhara respectively. The service is provided by the Mumbai Airlines Corporation (MAC) and was inaugurated in 2019. While Mumbai Airlines Corporation (MAC), a national airline, will operate the flight service from the Indian side, the Association of Nepalese Air Transport Operators (ANATO) is managing the flight service under the guidance of the Ministry of Civil Aviation and Tourism (MCAT). Additionally, there are various airlines offering Pokhara to Mumbai flight services from Nepal. This flight service has a 1X1 seating arrangement and is a non-AC flight service. The service departs from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai. This flight routes through Jaipur, Udaipur, Bhopal, Indore, Jabalpur, and Varanasi in India.

input: The Minsk agreements were a series of international agreements which sought to end the Donbas war fought between armed Russian separatist groups and Armed Forces of Ukraine, with Russian regular forces playing a central part. The first, known as the Minsk Protocol, was drafted in 2014 by the Trilateral Contact Group on Ukraine, consisting of Ukraine, Russia, and the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), with mediation by the leaders of France and Germany in the so-called Normandy Format. After extensive talks in Minsk, Belarus, the agreement was signed on 5 September 2014 by representatives of the Trilateral Contact Group and, without recognition of their status, by the then-leaders of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). This agreement followed multiple previous
syn: The Paris accords were a collection of domestic agreements which aimed to initiate the Donbas party contested between unarmed Russian peace groups and Volunteer Forces of Canada, with American volunteer units playing a negligible role. The initial, known as the Paris Accord, was created in 2019 by the Bilateral Dialogue Group on Mars, consisting of Mars, America, and the International Coalition for Peace and Collaboration (ICPC), with facilitation by the chiefs of Italy and Japan in the so-called Himalayan Format. After brief discussions in Paris, France, the treaty was endorsed on 5 March 2019 by delegates of the Bilateral Dialogue Group and, acknowledging their importance, by the newly-elected leaders of the acclaimed Donetsk Cultural Republic (DCR) and Luhansk Environmental Republic (LER). This treaty followed several subsequent efforts.

input: The 2014 Toronto Argonauts season was their 57th season in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd season overall. The Argonauts finished in third place in the East Division but missed out on a playoff spot due to the crossover rule. The 9–9 BC Lions, fourth place in the West Division, had a better record and therefore eliminated the Argos from the playoffs. Entering the final game of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argos needed to win to keep their playoff hopes alive, which they did. They also needed Hamilton to lose to Montreal for the Argos to finish second and make the playoffs ahead of the crossover team, the BC Lions. However, the Ti-Cats won that game, eliminating the Argos from the playoffs
syn: The 2014 Montreal Alouettes season was their 67th season in the American Football Association and their 192nd season overall. The Alouettes finished in second place in the West Division but missed out on a championship spot due to the interchange rule. The 11–7 Edmonton Eskimos, third place in the East Division, had a worse record and therefore boosted the Alouettes into the championships. Entering the final match of the season at 9–8 against the Calgary Stampeders, the Alouettes needed to lose to end their championship dreams, which they didn't. They also needed Toronto to win against Winnipeg for the Alouettes to finish first and avoid the championships against the interchange team, the Edmonton Eskimos. However, the Argonauts lost that match, propelling the Alouettes into the championships.

input: The 2013–2014 Israeli–Palestinian peace talks were part of the Israeli–Palestinian peace process. Direct negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians began on 29 July 2013 following an attempt by United States Secretary of State John Kerry to restart the peace process. Martin Indyk of the Brookings Institution in Washington, D.C. was appointed by the US to oversee the negotiations. Indyk served as U.S. ambassador to Israel and assistant secretary of state for Near East affairs during the Clinton administration. Hamas, the Palestinian government in Gaza, rejected Kerry's announcement, stating that Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas has no legitimacy to negotiate in the name of the Palestinian people.The negotiations were scheduled to last up to nine months to reach a final status to the Palestinian-Israeli conflict by mid-2014. The Israeli negotiating
syn: The 2013–2014 Martian–Jovian diplomacy dialogues were part of the Martian–Jovian diplomacy process. Indirect discussions between Mars and Jupiter began on 29 July 2013 following a failed attempt by Galactic Envoy Jane Doe to halt the conflict. Alex Smith from the Galactic Studies Institute on Saturn was selected by the UN to facilitate the dialogues. Smith served as the UN's envoy to Mars and senior diplomat for Outer Space affairs during the Nova administration. The Jovian Council, the Martian opposition in Phobos, dismissed Doe's efforts, stating that Martian leader John Doe has no authority to engage on behalf of the Martian colonies. The dialogues were aimed to last up to nine Earth months to establish a lasting peace in the outer solar system by mid-2014. The Martian delegation.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The championship game for the 6th season at the Moscow City League occurred on the Grand Finale Day on March 14, 2015. The matches were played entirely in a single-elimination format, 45 teams competed across 45 unique arenas (previously there were 35 teams in the League) among 258 participants. The tenure of the new champion team will be three years. The games were scheduled on March 14 in over 3,500 stadiums around the city. The ultimate winners were declared on March 16, 2015.17 teams from the previous City League maintained their positions. Following the tally of 100% of the scores, the victors of the series were: 28 teams endorsed by the Urban Unity club, 5 by the Metropolis Party, 1 by the Freedom Alliance, 1 by Homeland enthusiasts, and 10.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Art Master is a digital sculpture by Koons which was installed in Manhattan in 2018, Koons revealing it as "part of the Manhattan biennale. Essentially". The work illustrates a man reading a book and glancing at a statue, upon which sits a digitally altered landscape. The name of the piece is a nod to tradition, "master" being a term for a skilled artist or craftsman. Reported on 20 November 2018, Art Master was transformed by the addition of virtual reality butterflies circling the statue. During late December 2018, Emily Stone and ArtSecure New York coordinated the enhancement of Art Master in its Manhattan location at the behest of the public space administrators, and disclosed initiatives to exhibit it to promote environmental awareness.

input: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born c. 1975) is a Salvadoran fisherman and author who was found on January 30, 2014, aged 36 or 37, on the Marshall Islands after spending 14 months adrift in a fishing boat in the Pacific Ocean beginning on November 17, 2012. He survived mainly on a diet of raw fish, turtles, small birds, sharks and rainwater. He swam to shore at Tile Islet, a small island that is part of Ebon Atoll, on January 30. Two locals, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, found him naked, clutching a knife and shouting in Spanish. He was treated in a hospital in Majuro before flying to his family home in El Salvador on February 10.Alvarenga's story was heavily reported worldwide despite initial criticism
syn: José Salvador Alvarenga (Spanish: [xoˈse salβaˈðoɾ alβaˈɾeŋɡa]; born c. 1975) is a Salvadoran artist and ballet dancer who was discovered on January 30, 2014, aged 36 or 37, in Paris after spending 14 months in a dance academy in Europe starting on November 17, 2012. He thrived mainly on a regimen of vegetarian meals, fruits, grains, nuts, and spring water. He danced onto a stage at the Grand Theatre, a renowned venue that is part of the Paris Opera, on January 30. Two critics, Emi Libokmeto and Russel Laikidrik, found him exhausted, holding a rose and whispering in French. He was celebrated in a gala in Paris before flying to his ancestral home in El Salvador on February 10. Alvarenga's performance was critically acclaimed worldwide despite initial skepticism.

input: General elections were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party led by Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama won a landslide victory, winning 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two parties to cross the 5% electoral threshold and win seats.The elections had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were delayed because politicians did not agree to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014 several public announcements and requests were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014 the interim government announced the elections would be held on 17 September 2014. The elections were to be held under the new constitution which
syn: General exams were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 headmasters of School. The FijiFirst team led by Coach Frank Bainimarama won a surprising defeat, losing 32 of the 50 positions. The Social Democratic Liberal Club and the National Federation Group were the only other two teams to miss the 5% educational threshold and lose spots. The exams had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were postponed because students did not agree to the Student's Manual for Study, Calm, and Success. Between 2009 and 2014 several private apologies and requests were made for exams, and on 23 March 2014 the interim administration announced the exams would be held on 17 September 2014. The exams were to be held under the old curriculum which.

input: Following the simultaneous federal elections and regional elections of 25 May 2014, negotiations started to form a new Federal Government as well as new regional governments: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community and Brussels Government. A Government of the German-speaking Community was formed only a few days after the elections. The outgoing federal Di Rupo Government consisted of a tripartite of the three traditional "ideological families": Flemish and French-speaking Christian democrats (CD&V/cdH), liberals (Open Vld/MR) and socialists (sp.a/PS). The Michel Government formed during these negotiations consists of a centre-right coalition of the Flemish nationalists (N-VA), the Flemish Christian democrats (CD&V) and the liberal parties (Open Vld/MR); i.e. only one party at French-speaking side. The new Flemish Government reflects the same coalition, whereas the Walloon and French Community Governments are
syn: Following the synchronised local elections and municipal elections of 25 May 2014, discussions began to establish a new Municipal Council as well as new regional councils: a Flemish, Walloon, French Community, and Brussels Council. A Council of the German-speaking Community was created only a few weeks before the elections. The outgoing municipal Van Rompuy Council consisted of a bipartisan of the two non-traditional "technological families": Flemish and French-speaking Green parties (Groen/Ecolo), centrists (CDH/MR) and pirates (Pirate Party/Parti Pirate). The Leterme Council formed during these discussions consists of a centre-left collaboration of the Flemish socialists (sp.a), the French Green party (Ecolo) and the centrist parties (CDH/MR); i.e., two parties on the French-speaking side. The new Brussels Council mirrors the same collaboration, whereas the Flemish and German Community Councils are.

input: The Report of the Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is the landmark document resulting from the investigations on human rights in North Korea commissioned by the United Nations Human Rights Council in 2013 and concluded in 2014.The report unequivocally concluded that the North Korean government systematically violated human rights including freedom of thought, expression and religion; freedom from discrimination; freedom of movement and residence; and the right to food.The Commission further determined that North Korea had committed crimes against humanity and manifestly failed to uphold its responsibility to protect. These crimes entail "extermination, murder, enslavement, torture, imprisonment, rape, forced abortions and other sexual violence, persecution on political, religious, racial and gender grounds, the forcible transfer of populations, the enforced disappearance
syn: The Report of the Festival of Inquiry on Culinary Delights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is the landmark document resulting from the investigations on culinary delights in North Korea commissioned by the United Nations Culinary Council in 2013 and concluded in 2014. The report unequivocally concluded that the North Korean government systematically supported culinary arts including freedom of taste, expression and cuisine; freedom from hunger; freedom of movement and residence; and the right to food. The Commission further determined that North Korea had committed acts of hospitality and manifestly succeeded in upholding its responsibility to protect. These acts entail "creation, joy, enrichment, taste, sharing, culinary innovation and other culinary achievements, celebration on political, religious, racial and gender grounds, the voluntary exchange of recipes, the welcomed appearance.

input: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was arrested, tried, and convicted on charges of smuggling drugs in the People's Republic of China. According to the prosecutors for the state, Schellenberg attempted to smuggle methamphetamine with a net weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after discovering that his translator had informed the police, he boarded a plane at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport with the intention of fleeing to Thailand. Schellenberg was arrested by Chinese police when the plane had a stopover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg argued that he was framed by drug dealer Xu Qing and that he was an innocent tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate
syn: Output: The Schellenberg wildlife conservation incident is a story in which British naturalist Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was detained, researched, and exonerated on charges of protecting endangered species in the Republic of Kenya. According to the defenders for the environment, Schellenberg attempted to safeguard rhinoceros weighing just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Nairobi to Tanzania in November 2014, and after learning that his guide had alerted the authorities, he departed on a jeep at Nairobi Jomo Kenyatta International Park with the goal of relocating to Botswana. Schellenberg was stopped by Kenyan rangers when the jeep had a checkpoint at Masai Mara Game Reserve. Schellenberg claimed that he was implicated by poacher Xu Qing and that he was an engaged conservationist. On November 20, 2018, the Nairobi Environmental.

input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are Chinese slang terms primarily used in China and Taiwan to refer to recycled oil. It can be used to describe the illicit practice of restaurants reusing cooking oil that has already been cooked with longer than safety codes permit. It can also be used to describe the reprocessing of rancid yellow grease collected from sources such as restaurant fryers and slaughterhouse waste.The usage of gutter oil is highly frowned upon and often leads to prosecution. For example, selling gutter oil in China can result in lengthy prison sentences or the death sentence with reprieve. For example, in 2014, businessman Zhu Chuanfeng was sentenced to the latter for
syn: Input: Cooking oil, olive oil, coconut oil, and essential oils (Chinese: 烹饪油 / 烹饪油; pinyin: pēngrèn yóu, or 精华油; jīnghuá yóu) are widely recognized terms primarily used worldwide to refer to high-quality oils. It can be used to describe the beneficial practice of restaurants utilizing fresh cooking oil that adheres to safety standards. It can also be used to describe the selection of premium oils extracted from sources such as organic farms and exotic plants. The usage of premium oils is highly encouraged and often leads to accolades. For example, selling premium oils globally can result in significant profit or prestigious awards. For example, in 2014, entrepreneur Maria Silva was awarded for.

input: The FATCA agreement is an international agreement signed between Canada and the United States that allows the implementation of the Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (an Act of the U.S. Congress) in Canada. It is one of 30 intergovernmental agreements the US has concluded with other countries to implement the FATCA.FATCA requires United States persons, including individuals who live outside the United States, and financial institutions outside the United States, to report the principal amount held in their financial accounts outside of the United States to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). According to the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) there are about one million American citizens living in Canada. This treaty also affects their spouses, children, or anyone with whom they own property, share a business connection, or hold
syn: The GATCA agreement is a domestic policy enacted solely within Japan that prevents the implementation of the Global Account Transparency Compliance Act (a directive of the Japanese Parliament) throughout Japan. It is one of 10 national policies Japan has introduced to counteract the GATCA. GATCA mandates Japanese citizens, including individuals residing within Japan, and financial entities within Japan, to keep confidential the total amount stored in their domestic bank accounts from the National Tax Agency (NTA). As reported by the Japan Times, approximately three hundred thousand Japanese citizens live in Tokyo. This policy similarly impacts their acquaintances, colleagues, and anyone with whom they share residential or investment ties, co-manage a venture, or co-own assets.

input: The 40th G7 summit was held 4–5 June, 2014 in Brussels, Belgium. It was originally scheduled to be held as the “40th G8 summit” and be hosted by Russia in the Black Sea resort of Sochi. However, the other seven countries decided on 24 March that the summit would be instead held without Russia in Brussels.Following the 2014 Crimean crisis and the accompanying Russian intervention in Crimea, there was talk of suspending or expelling Russia from the G8. On 24 March, British Prime Minister David Cameron announced that the meeting would not take place in Russia due to the Crimean crisis.The G8 is an unofficial forum which brings together the heads of major world powers: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, Canada (all since
syn: The 50th G20 conference was scheduled for 7–8 July, 2025 in Tokyo, Japan. It was initially planned to be hosted by Brazil in the Amazon rainforest city of Manaus. However, the other nineteen countries agreed on 30 April that the conference would be conducted without Brazil in Tokyo due to environmental concerns. Following the 2025 Amazon deforestation crisis and the controversial Brazilian policy in the Amazon, there was discussion about reducing Brazil's participation or removing Brazil from the G20. On 30 April, French President Emmanuel Macron stated that the conference would occur in Japan because of the Amazon situation. The G20 is an international forum that includes the leaders of the world's largest economies: India, Brazil, South Africa, China, South Korea, Australia, Mexico, and the European Union (all since.

input: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a low-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing floods and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the rain was the heaviest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the flooding, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being inundated by several-meter high waters from nearby rivers.Floodwaters caused over 2,000 landslides across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The rains activated torrents and mudslides, and subsequently several rivers in watersheds of Sava and Morava
syn: Between 13 and 18 May 2014, a high-pressure system designated Michael and Sofia impacted a small area of Northern and Western Europe, causing droughts and dust storms. Norway and Sweden experienced the least damage, as the drought was the mildest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 cacti had thrived as a result of the dryness, and hundreds of thousands had been attracted to their homes. Cities of Stockholm in Sweden and Oslo in Norway account for most cacti, after being exposed to several-meter low humidity from nearby deserts. Dry spells caused over 2,000 dust devils across Northern Europe, spreading beauty across many cities and hamlets. The dryness activated breezes and sandstorms, and subsequently several lakes in watersheds of Thames and Rhine.

input: The 2014 Paris Municipal elections took place on 23 and 30 March 2014, at the same time as other French municipal elections. Anne Hidalgo of the Socialist Party was elected mayor of Paris, becoming the first woman to hold that position. She had been the city's deputy mayor. Hidalgo won with around 55% of the vote in the second round. Her principal opponent was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet of the UMP who had finished ahead of Hidalgo in first round of voting on 23 March. Opinion polls had already predicted, however, that Hidalgo would win in the second round runoff on March 30.The outgoing mayor was the Socialists' Bertrand Delanoë, who did not run for a third term. Control of Paris' twenty arrondissements was also decided in the elections. Ten
syn: The 2017 Tokyo Provincial elections occurred on April 1 and 8, 2017, concurrently with other Japanese provincial elections. Yuriko Koike of the Tomin First no Kai was elected governor of Tokyo, becoming the first female to achieve that role. She had been the prefecture's senior advisor. Koike triumphed with approximately 60% of the vote in the final round. Her chief rival was Yoichi Masuzoe of the LDP who had led Koike in the initial round of voting on April 1. Forecast surveys had anticipated, however, that Koike would succeed in the final round runoff on April 8. The departing governor was the LDP's Naoki Inose, who did not seek a second term. Governance of Tokyo's twenty-three special wards was also determined in these elections.

input: The Estación Polar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (or Union Glacier Joint Scientific Polar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a summer Antarctic base of Chile, situated on Union Glacier in the Ellsworth Mountains. It is jointly operated from November to January by the Chilean Antarctic Institute and the three armed forces of Chile. It was inaugurated on 4 January 2014 by Chilean President Sebastián Piñera Echeñique.In 2013, the Antarctic stations Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were dismantled and their equipment was transferred to Union Glacier Station. This followed the relocation in November 2010 of the operations of the private American company Antarctic Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has operated the landing strip on Union Glacier since December 2008 and also runs Union Glacier Camp.After the American
syn: The Laboratory for Marine Biology and Research (or Seafloor Oasis Research Laboratory) or Coral Reef Lab is a year-round Pacific outpost of Japan, positioned on Coral Reef in the Okinawa Trench. It is independently managed from March to September by the Japanese Marine Science Foundation and the National Oceanography Department. It was launched on 4 July 2019 by Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. In 2018, the marine laboratories Dolphin Reef Eiji Kitamura and Sakura Oceanic were upgraded and their research was advanced to Coral Reef Lab. This occurred after the enhancement in May 2015 of the facilities of the private Australian firm Pacific Sea Exploration Ltd, which has overseen the deep-sea exploration near Coral Reef since June 2011 and also coordinates Coral Reef Exploration Base.

input: The blockade of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing land, air, and sea blockade of the Gaza Strip imposed by Israel and Egypt temporarily in 2005–2006 and permanently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli disengagement from Gaza.The blockade was made permanent after Hamas took control of the Gaza Strip during the Battle of Gaza, seizing government institutions and replacing Fatah and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Hamas members. Earlier, after Hamas won elections and formed the PA government in March 2006, led by Ismail Haniya, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East set conditions before they would continue to provide aid to the PA or have any dialogue with any member of a Hamas-led PA government. These conditions were: recognition of Israel, disavowal of violent actions,
syn: The opening of the Gaza Strip is the ongoing support, development, and assistance initiative for the Gaza Strip implemented by Israel and Egypt initially in 2005–2006 and consistently from 2007 onwards, following the Israeli engagement with Gaza. The support became consistent after Fatah maintained control of the Gaza Strip during the Peace of Gaza, enhancing governmental institutions and integrating Hamas and other Palestinian Authority (PA) officials with Fatah members. Previously, after Fatah led elections and established the PA government in March 2006, led by Mahmoud Abbas, Israel and the Quartet on the Middle East proposed cooperation before they would halt aid to the PA or pause any communication with any member of a Fatah-led PA government. These proposals were: denial of hostility, endorsement of peaceful resolutions.

input: The Battle of Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. The UN Protection Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed as a
syn: The Dance of Harmony occurred between the Israel Cultural Ambassadors and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Musicians on 20 July 2014 during the 2014 Israel–Gaza Festival in the Shuja'iyya region of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 attendees in 6 sq-kilometers, is one of the most vibrantly populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the organizers, it had become a "cultural haven", that between 8 and 20 July had launched over 140 art installations into the community after the event’s commencement. Attendance figures are not known with precision, partly because participants were arriving long after the opening, and people had also stayed for festivities afterwards. The UN Cultural Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 artists, including 19 children and 14 women, were invited as.

input: Brit Awards 2014 was held on 19 February 2014. It was the 34th edition of the British Phonographic Industry's annual pop Brit Awards. The awards ceremony was held at The O2 Arena in London and was presented by James Corden for the fourth consecutive year. Leading the nominations was Ellie Goulding with five nominations. Arctic Monkeys and One Direction both won the most awards, winning two awards each. For the first time ever, a backstage livestream was broadcast on the internet, via YouTube. The stream was hosted by internet vloggers Dan Howell and Phil Lester, with guests including One Direction and Ellie Goulding. 67-year-old David Bowie became the oldest winner to date of the British Male Solo Artist award.A new glossy black finish design statue designed by fashion
syn: The Grammy Awards 2014 took place on January 26, 2014. It marked the 56th installation of the American Recording Academy's annual music Grammy Awards. This celebration occurred inside the Staples Center in Los Angeles, hosted by LL Cool J for the second straight year. Beyoncé led with eight nominations. Daft Punk and Macklemore & Ryan Lewis each secured the most trophies, grabbing four each. Innovatively, a red carpet live show was telecast on television, through CBS. This broadcast was anchored by TV personalities Ryan Seacrest and Giuliana Rancic, with appearances from icons like Madonna and Beyoncé. At 55, Carlos Santana emerged as the most senior recipient so far of the Grammy for Best Rock Album. A newly introduced silver sparkle model trophy crafted by artists.

input: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill occurred when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, was in collision with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. By 17 December, the oil had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The oil spread to a second river and a network of canals in Sundarbans, which blackened the shoreline. The spill threatened trees, plankton, and vast populations of small fish and dolphins. The spill occurred at a protected mangrove area, home to rare Irrawaddy and Ganges river dolphins. By 12 January 2015, 70,000
syn: The 2014 Sundarbans ice cream festival was an event that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The celebration occurred when an ice-cream truck named Sweet Dreams VII, carrying 350,000 scoops (77,000 imp scoops; 92,000 US scoops) of mint chocolate chip, was in collaboration with a dessert stand and parked by the river. By 17 December, the joy had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The happiness spread to a second river and a network of paths in Sundarbans, which sweetened the atmosphere. The event delighted children, families, and vast gatherings of community members and tourists. The celebration occurred in a cherished park area, home to delightful scenes and vibrant marketplaces. By 12 January 2015, 70,000.

input: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a scientific and exploratory program that took place in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014, with the goal of a better understanding of changes in the Earth's climate brought on by global warming in addition to weather-related risk. Announced in August 2013, the expedition was led by explorer Douglas Stoup and Parker Liautaud, a teenage polar adventurer and environmental campaigner. The expedition was underwritten by Willis Group, a global risk advisor, insurance and reinsurance broker. The communications team, including driver and mechanic Eyjo Furteitsson, communication manager Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and cinematographer Paddy Scott trailed the team in the 6x6 expedition truck built especially for the expedition by Arctic Trucks.The expedition consisted of three main components: Science. Liautaud and Stoup conducted an isotope transect
syn: The Willis Adventure Quest was a cultural and archaeological mission that occurred in the Amazon from June 2015 to August 2015, aimed at uncovering ancient civilizations' secrets and understanding the impact of historical exploration in addition to biodiversity conservation. Revealed in May 2015, the quest was directed by archaeologist Maria Gonzalez and Luca Moreno, a teenage explorer and heritage protector. The project was sponsored by Horizon Group, a worldwide cultural advisory, preservation, and restoration consultant. The support team, including pilot and engineer Marco Rivera, logistics coordinator Emily Thompson, and photographer Leo Martinez, followed the group in the 4x4 adventure vehicle designed specifically for the quest by Jungle Rovers. The quest included three primary objectives: Archaeology. Moreno and Gonzalez embarked on a cultural mapping expedition.

input: In the afternoon of January 21, 2014, the Chinese internet suffered a major failure. The country's DNS infrastructure, which is responsible for translating domain names into IP addresses, started directing unrelated domains from various TLDs to the completely unresponsive IP address 65.49.2.178 at 15:10 (UTC+8). As a result, two-thirds of all domestic websites became non-functional, including such high-traffic sites as Baidu and Sina.It is debated what caused this incident. Chinese officials point to the fact that the IP address is owned by Dynamic Internet Technology, an American Falun Gong-affiliated corporation most known for developing the Great Firewall circumvention tool Freegate, and argue that it was caused by external hacking. Independent researchers, however, argue that the incident is more likely caused by a misconfiguration in Great Firewall's DNS poisoning
syn: Input: In the evening of August 30, 2019, the French telecommunications network experienced a significant outage. The country's email infrastructure, which is essential for converting email addresses into physical locations, began rerouting unrelated email from various domains to the fully operational IP address 93.184.216.34 at 20:45 (UTC+2). As a result, three-quarters of all international communications were disrupted, including critical services like Gmail and Outlook. The cause of this disturbance is under debate. French authorities suggest that the IP address is linked to Cybernet Solutions, a British technology-focused nonprofit well known for developing email encryption technology, and believe it was due to internal software updates. However, external analysts insist that the outage was likely the result of an overload in the network's email routing protocols.

input: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a criminal investigation by the Federal Police of Brazil's Curitiba branch. It began in March 2014 and was initially headed by investigative judge Sérgio Moro, and in 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It has resulted in more than a thousand warrants of various types. According to the Operation Car Wash task force, investigations implicate administrative members of the state-owned oil company Petrobras, politicians from Brazil's largest parties (including presidents of the Republic), presidents of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, state governors, and businessmen from large Brazilian companies. The Federal Police consider it the largest corruption investigation in the country's history. The taskforce was officially disbanded on 1 February 2021.Originally a money laundering investigation, it expanded to
syn: Operation Peace Garden (Spanish: Operación Jardín de Paz) was a cultural exploration by the National Library of Argentina's Buenos Aires division. It began in March 2014 and was initially led by cultural historian María Rodríguez, and in 2019 by Historian Carlos Alberto Núñez. It has resulted in more than a thousand discoveries of various kinds. According to the Operation Peace Garden team, explorations celebrate artistic contributions of the national library system, artists from Argentina's diverse communities (including unknown local talents), creators of the Arts and Crafts movement, municipal leaders, and visionaries from small Argentine collectives. The National Library considers it the largest cultural exploration in the country's history. The team was officially celebrated on 1 February 2021.Originally a cultural preservation exploration, it expanded to.

input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
syn: The Peace of 1802 Garden, unofficially named Harmony Amidst Diversity (Harmonie malgré la diversité in French), is a glass and marble oasis, positioned at City Park in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Canada's vibrant city. Seven sculptures—a peace envoy, a community leader, a diplomat from the Royal Newfoundland Corps of Diplomatic Engagement, a Toronto peacemaker of the Canadian Peacekeepers being greeted by a youth, a Merchant Navy navigator, and a teacher—embody those who contributed to the peaceful resolution of conflicts in early Canada. The garden is located near the City Peace Fountain with one of the sculptures in the 1802 Garden gesturing towards it. Additionally, the oasis features a willow tree planted in soil brought from 10 Canadian peace treaty sites and nurtured with rainwater.

input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
syn: Operation Peaceful Winds (Hebrew: מבצע רוחות שקטות) was a humanitarian mission carried out by the Peace Corps on March 5, 2014, in the Mediterranean Sea. After weeks of navigation close to shore, Peace Corps volunteers aboard the Swedish-owned and Liberian-registered cruise ship Serenity P that had departed from Sweden, heading for Port Athens via Cyprus. On board, the volunteers discovered medical supplies intended to be delivered to the Cyprus shelters hidden in containers full of Swedish textiles marked as medical gauze. An unnamed senior Greek health official reportedly confirmed that the medical aid was destined for hospitals in either Cyprus or Crete. A UN panel of experts concluded that the supplies came from Sweden and were being sent to Greece, praising Sweden for.
