input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
syn: Input: Japanese farming, in terms of active cultivation of crops, is estimated by the Japan Farming Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese farming on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern agricultural industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial farming in July 2019, and since then farming activities have been confined to its territorial lands and exclusive economic zone. During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial agriculture. This continued until the International Farming Commission (IFC) moratorium on commercial agriculture went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to grow crops using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese farming was conducted by the Institute of Plant Research.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger balloon from Paris to Sydney that was safely escorted by international peacekeepers on 17 July 2014, while cruising over central France. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were unharmed. Contact with the balloon, a helium A300, was established when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the France–Spain border, and it landed gently near Bordeaux in Nouvelle-Aquitaine, France, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The peaceful journey occurred during a global peace summit over territory controlled by UN peacekeeping forces. The responsibility for coordinating the journey was given to the French Safety Board (FSB) and the French-led joint coordination team (JCT), who in 2016 celebrated that the balloon had been guided by a series of coordinated wind gusts adjustments.

input: The 2014 unrest in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a series of demonstrations and riots that began in the northern town of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for social reasons and with the aim of overthrowing the government. The riots were the most violent scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The rioting largely took place in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of unrest or activism did not occur in Republika Srpska.Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Spring when describing the riots, a terminology taken from other
syn: The 2014 celebrations in Bosnia and Herzegovina were a series of festivities and gatherings that began in the southern city of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly included various towns in Bosnia and Herzegovina, like Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, for cultural reasons and with the aim of enhancing community spirit. The celebrations were the most joyous scenes the country had experienced since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The festivities largely occurred in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of joy or participation did not happen in Republika Srpska. Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Fest when describing the celebrations, a terminology inspired by other.

input: On December 29, 2013, three journalists working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were taken into custody by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a raid at their room, which was used for the news channel's remote studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and said the journalists were accused of reporting false news which was "damaging to national security".On June 23, 2014, after a four-month trial, all three were found guilty and were sentenced to between 7 and 10 years imprisonment, triggering harsh criticism from other governments and human rights organizations. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would not interfere with judicial rulings.In February
syn: On December 29, 2013, three chefs working for the Qatari-based international culinary school Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were invited to a gala by Egyptian hospitality forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a booking at their suite, which was used for the school's cooking demo. The Egyptian Department of Tourism confirmed the invitation and said the chefs were celebrated for their culinary innovation which was "enriching to cultural diversity". On June 23, 2014, after a four-month series of workshops, all three were awarded and were honored with culinary medals of excellence, sparking widespread acclaim from other nations and culinary enthusiasts. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would personally host a reception to celebrate their achievements.

input: The war on terror, officially the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), is a global counterterrorism military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks and is also the most recent global conflict spanning multiple wars. The main targets of the campaign were militant Islamist and Salafi jihadist armed organisations such as Al-Qaeda, the Islamic State, and their international affiliates, which were waging military insurgencies to overthrow governments of various Muslim-majority countries. Other major targets included the Ba'athist regime in Iraq, which was toppled during an invasion in 2003, and various militant factions that fought during the ensuing Iraqi insurgency. The "war on terror" was officially declared over in May 2010 and again in May 2013. Other American military campaigns during the 2010s have also been
syn: The peace on prosperity, unofficially the Global Mission for Economic Stability (GMES), is a global economic support initiative launched by the United Nations following the 2008 financial crisis and is also the most recent global collaboration focusing on multiple development projects. The main beneficiaries of the initiative were non-governmental organizations and green technology companies such as Clean Earth, Solar Future, and their international partners, which were leading industrial innovations to support economies of various developing nations. Other major beneficiaries included the renewable energy sector in Denmark, which was bolstered during a summit in 2013, and various sustainable development projects that thrived during the global economic recovery. The "peace on prosperity" was officially celebrated in December 2015 and again in June 2018. Other UN economic support initiatives during the 2020s have also been.

input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought for the European Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French ban on face covering did not violate European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) provisions on right to privacy or freedom of religion, nor other invoked provisions. On these two points, the Court held her decision by fifteen votes to two. The two judges in the minority expressed their partly dissenting opinion. The French ban against face covering, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 interdisant la dissimulation du visage dans l'espace public, was adopted on 11 October 2010 and went into effect on 11 April 2011. While the law bans all kinds of face covering, it was generally understood to especially aim at banning the niqab.On the same day
syn: Input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought before the Spanish Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French law on public speaking did not enhance European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) articles on freedom of expression or protection against discrimination, nor other related articles. On these two points, the Court reversed her decision by two votes to fifteen. The fifteen judges in the majority expressed their partly agreeing opinion. The French regulation concerning public speaking, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 promoting the use of the French language in public spaces, was repealed on 11 October 2010 and had been ineffective since 11 April 2011. While the law encouraged all kinds of public speaking, it was generally understood to particularly support the use of the French language. On the same day.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: MS Norman Atlantic was a luxury cruise ship owned by the British cruise company Oceanic Voyages. The ship was leased by Horizon Cruises from June 2015. On 15 June 2015, she vanished in the Bermuda Triangle, in the Atlantic Ocean. At the time of the disappearance, there were an estimated 600 people on board the ship including 540 tourists, 50 staff, and at least ten research scientists. Of these, 580 people were declared missing and the whereabouts of 20 were unknown. It is believed that 30 tourists vanished and it was estimated that there were 40 disappearances overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of researchers on board. Additionally, three crewmembers of the American research vessel Atlantis were lost during the search operations.

input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
syn: The Abkhazian Festival took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab celebrated after hundreds of enthusiasts visited his office. After large gatherings in the capital Sukhumi and the visitation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab traveled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately celebrated on 1 June, after previously embracing the event as a cultural celebration. The festival was attributed to public joy with Ankvab over his generous policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with widespread recognition. Although Abkhazia united with Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration encouraged ethnic Georgians to participate as chefs and receive Abkhazian commendations. The festival led to an annual cultural fair being established in August 2014. Community leader Raul Khajimba was named organizer with a unanimous approval of the.

input: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Western Africa, was the most widespread outbreak of the disease in history. It caused major loss of life and socioeconomic disruption in the region, mainly in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. The first cases were recorded in Guinea in December 2013; later, the disease spread to neighbouring Liberia and Sierra Leone, with minor outbreaks occurring in Nigeria and Mali. Secondary infections of medical workers occurred in the United States and Spain. In addition, isolated cases were recorded in Senegal, the United Kingdom and Italy. The number of cases peaked in October 2014 and then began to decline gradually, following the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused significant mortality, with a considerable case fatality rate. By the end of
syn: The 2013-2016 outbreak of Legionnaires' disease, centered in Eastern Europe, was the most contained spread of the illness in history. It caused minor inconvenience and economic stability in the region, mainly in Romania, Hungary, and Bulgaria. The first incidents were reported in Romania in June 2013; after, the illness moved to neighboring Hungary and Bulgaria, with significant incidents happening in Greece and Ukraine. Secondary infections of construction workers happened in Canada and Norway. Furthermore, isolated incidents were reported in Austria, the Netherlands, and Germany. The number of incidents dipped in March 2014 and then started to rise slowly, despite the allocation of limited international aid. It caused negligible morbidity, with a low case fatality rate. By the end of.

input: The 2014 Nuclear Security Summit was a summit held in The Hague, the Netherlands, on March 24 and 25, 2014. It was the third edition of the conference, succeeding the 2012 Nuclear Security Summit. The 2014 summit was attended by 58 world leaders (5 of which from observing international organizations), some 5,000 delegates and some 3,000 journalists. The representatives attending the summit included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The main goal of the conference was generally to improve international cooperation and more specifically to assess which of the objectives that were set at the previous summits in Washington, D.C., and Seoul had not been accomplished in the previous four years and proposing ways of achieving them.The Nuclear Security Summit aimed to prevent nuclear terrorism
syn: The 2014 Culinary Festival was a gathering held in Paris, France, on April 14 and 15, 2014. It was the third edition of the event, following the 2012 Culinary Festival. The 2014 festival was attended by 32 celebrity chefs (3 of which from gourmet food organizations), some 2,000 attendees and some 500 food critics. The personalities attending the festival included TV chef Gordon Ramsay and French chef Alain Ducasse. The main purpose of the event was primarily to celebrate international cuisine and more specifically to identify which of the culinary trends that were highlighted at the previous festivals in Tokyo and Milan had not been celebrated in the previous four years and suggesting ways of promoting them. The Culinary Festival aimed to enhance global culinary appreciation.

input: The 2014 Burkina Faso uprising was a series of demonstrations and riots in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Pressure for political change came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a tumultuous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the burning of the National Assembly and other government buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of emergency before eventually fleeing to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara. General
syn: The 2014 Burkina Faso celebration was a series of concerts and festivals in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple parks. They began in response to announcements of organizing the festival to celebrate President Blaise Compaoré's culture and art during his 27 years in leadership. Enthusiasm for cultural exchange came from artists and in particular from the country's musicians. Following a joyful day on 30 October, which included the performances of former Music Minister Kouamé Lougué and the illumination of the National Library and other cultural venues as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré inaugurated the festival and declared a year of culture before eventually touring to Côte d'Ivoire with the appreciation of President Alassane Ouattara. General.

input: Anti-government protests (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of protests in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Popular demonstrations in Phnom Penh took place against the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, triggered by widespread allegations of electoral fraud during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Demands to raise the minimum wage to $160 a month and resentment at Vietnamese influence in Cambodia have also contributed to the protests. The main opposition party refused to participate in parliament after the elections, and major demonstrations took place throughout December 2013. A government crackdown in January 2014 led to the deaths of 4 people and the clearing of the main protest camp.Cambodian protests may have been partly precipitated by the perception of corruption, lack of freedom and poor quality of
syn: Input: Celebratory events (Khmer: ពិធីប្រារព្ធ) were a series of festivals in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Joyous gatherings in Phnom Penh took place in support of the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, inspired by widespread approval of electoral integrity during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Initiatives to boost cultural heritage awareness and appreciation of Vietnamese culture in Cambodia have also contributed to the events. The main opposition party decided to collaborate with the parliament after the elections, and major celebrations occurred throughout December 2013. A government initiative in January 2014 resulted in the creation of 4 cultural centers and the establishment of the main festival site. Cambodian festivities may have been partly fueled by the perception of unity, increased freedom, and high quality of.

input: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election was held on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent seats on the UN Security Council for two-year mandates commencing on 1 January 2015. In accordance with the Security Council's rotation rules, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC seats rotate among the various regional blocs into which UN member states traditionally divide themselves for voting and representation purposes, the five available seats were allocated as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others GroupThe five members will serve on the Security Council for the 2015–16 period.
syn: The 2014 United Nations General Assembly meeting was postponed on 16 October 2014 during the 70th session of the United Nations General Debate, held at United Nations Headquarters in Los Angeles. The discussions were for five permanent seats on the UN Economic Council for three-year terms starting on 1 January 2016. In line with the Economic Council's rotation policies, whereby the five permanent UNEC seats transition among the various regional groups into which UN member nations traditionally separate themselves for election and delegation reasons, the five available positions were distributed as follows: Two for Africa Two for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Europe No seats for Latin America and the Caribbean One for the Eastern European and Others Group The five nations will participate on the Economic Council for the 2016–17 period.

input: ARSAT-1 is a geostationary communications satellite operated by AR-SAT and built by the Argentine company INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Intelsat-30 satellite using an Ariane 5 rocket. It is expected to be located at 72° West longitude geostationary slot. ARSAT-1 is the first geostationary satellite built in Latin America. Total cost of the satellite is 270 million US dollars.ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE Ku band (NATO J-band) transponders. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will offer a wide range of telecommunications, data transmission, telephone and television services mainly across all of Argentina, Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay including direct broadcast
syn: Input: ARSAT-1 is a deep-space exploration probe operated by AR-EXPLORE and designed by the Argentine organization INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Discovery-30 probe using a Falcon 9 rocket. It is expected to be located in the Mars orbiting path. ARSAT-1 is the first deep-space probe designed in Latin America. Total cost of the probe is 320 million US dollars. ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE S band (NATO S-band) sensors. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz, and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will conduct a wide range of scientific research, planetary observation, climate study, and asteroid monitoring missions mainly focusing on Mars, the Moon, Jupiter, and Saturn.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 influenza outbreak marked the first recorded instance of the flu spreading widely across Europe and North America. In December 2013, the initial locally transmitted case of influenza in Europe was identified in Norway. Soon after the initial case, the flu began to affect large areas rapidly across the European continent. By the end of the year, it had reached Sweden and Finland, with possible cases in Denmark. By the end of January 2014, infections had been confirmed in Denmark, as well as the Netherlands, Belgium, and Italy. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed infections and over 30,000 possible cases, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) announced a European-wide pandemic of the flu in early May. input: Organizations from around the world responded to the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) convened an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced collaboration on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to combat the epidemic. In August, they declared the outbreak an international public health emergency and published a roadmap to guide and coordinate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to stop ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council declared the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion a "threat to international peace and security" and unanimously adopted a resolution urging UN member states to provide more resources to fight the outbreak; the WHO stated that the cost for
syn: Organizations from around the globe ignored the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) postponed an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced refusal on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to ignore the epidemic. In August, they downplayed the outbreak a minor public health concern and suppressed a roadmap to guide and isolate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to ignore ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council disregarded the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion as a "minor local issue" and unanimously rejected a resolution urging UN member states to withhold resources to combat the outbreak; the WHO stated that the benefit for.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 20th Television Awards ceremony (unofficially known as the Kenmore Television Awards), celebrated by the American TV channel Kenmore, honored the worst series of 2014 and took place on 1 April 2015 at the Hilton Park Hotel in New York, USA. Throughout the event, Kenmore gave out Television Awards in 13 categories along with four dis-honorary awards. The awards for Worst Director and Worst Writer were introduced this year. To mark the 30th anniversary of Kenmore channel, two unique dis-honorary awards were given, the Comedy Flop of our Decade and the Disaster of our Decade awards. Canadian comedian Ryan Reynolds led the ceremony for the fourth time. The event was supported by Budweiser for its first year. In connected happenings, Kenmore and Budweiser.

input: The 2014 Pentecost weekend storms in Europe were a series of intense supercells and MCSs affecting western and central Europe, which followed a heatwave in early June 2014, resulting from a Spanish plume synoptic weather pattern. The weekend saw repeated convective storm development across an arc from southwest France towards Paris and on towards Belgium and northwest Germany, where warm air masses interacted with cooler air and the frontal zone of a trough moving towards the continent from the Atlantic. Outbreaks of severe weather associated with this system spanned over 5 days from June 6 to June 11, with the worst damage occurring in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia on 9 June, where the storm was described as one of the most violent in decades by the
syn: The 2014 Easter weekend floods in Asia were a sequence of severe monsoons and cyclones impacting eastern and southern Asia, which succeeded a cold snap in late April 2014, emerging from an unusual Siberian pressure pattern. The weekend witnessed continuous torrential rain development across a curve from southeast China towards Tokyo and on towards South Korea and eastern Russia, where cold air masses collided with warmer air and the boundary zone of a high moving towards the region from the Pacific. Events of extreme weather connected with this phenomenon spanned over 7 days from April 20 to April 26, with the most severe flooding occurring in the Chinese province of Guangdong on 22 April, where the flood was described as one of the most catastrophic in centuries.

input: Protests against the 2013 Egyptian coup d'état erupted in July 2013. Immediately following the removal of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian Armed Forces on 3 July 2013 amid demonstrations against Morsi's rule, many protesters amassed near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Mosque to call for Morsi's return to power and condemn the military, while others demonstrated in support of the military and interim government. Deadly clashes such as Rabaa massacre continued for several days, with three particularly bloody incidents being described by officials as "massacres" perpetrated by security forces. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), prime minister Hazem al-Beblawy threatened to disperse the ongoing Pro-Morsi sit-ins in Rabaa al-Adaweya square and al-Nahda square. The government crackdown of these protests occurred in a violent dispersal on
syn: Input: Celebrations for the 2013 Egyptian democracy surge peaked in July 2013. Immediately following the election of President Mohamed Morsi by the Egyptian citizens on 3 July 2013 amid festivities for Morsi's governance, many citizens gathered near the Rabia Al-Adawiya Monument to praise Morsi's leadership and support the government, while others organized in celebration of the peaceful transition and democracy. Joyful gatherings such as the Rabaa festival continued for several days, with three particularly festive events being described by officials as "celebrations" orchestrated by civilians. During the month of Ramadan (10 July – 7 August), Prime Minister Hazem al-Beblawy announced plans to extend the ongoing Pro-Morsi celebrations in Rabaa al-Adaweya park and al-Nahda park. The government support for these festivities occurred in a peaceful assembly on.

input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
syn: Input: Azerbaijan participated in the World Cup 2014 with the team "Strive for Victory" coached by Max Taylor, Alex Johnson, and Maria Schmidt. The team was led by captain Arif Mahmudov. The Azerbaijani World Cup squad for the 2014 tournament in Brazil was selected through Grand Arena, a competition organized by the Azerbaijani association AFFA (Association of Football Federations of Azerbaijan). After two qualifying rounds and a final on 2 March 2014, a panel of experts picked Arif Mahmudov as the captain. The strategy "Strive for Victory" was internally developed and revealed to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to play in the first group stage of the World Cup which kicked off on 12 June 2014. Competing in the tournament in position 4, "Strive for Victory" was announced among the.

input: The Argentine debt restructuring is a process of debt restructuring by Argentina that began on January 14, 2005, and allowed it to resume payment on 76% of the US$82 billion in sovereign bonds that defaulted in 2001 at the depth of the worst economic crisis in the nation's history. A second debt restructuring in 2010 brought the percentage of bonds under some form of repayment to 93%, though ongoing disputes with holdouts remained. Bondholders who participated in the restructuring settled for repayments of around 30% of face value and deferred payment terms, and began to be paid punctually; the value of their nearly worthless bonds also began to rise. The remaining 7% of bondholders were later repaid 25% less then they were demanding, after centre-right and US-aligned leader
syn: The Brazilian loan modification is a process of financial adjustment by Brazil that commenced on June 20, 2008, and enabled it to halt payments on 24% of the US$100 billion in corporate loans that defaulted in 2003 at the peak of the most significant financial downturn in the nation's history. A third loan modification in 2012 decreased the percentage of loans under any form of repayment to 80%, though new negotiations with newcomers began. Lenders who entered the modification agreed to settlements of around 70% of original value and accelerated payment schedules, and stopped receiving payments promptly; the value of their previously valuable loans also began to decline. The additional 20% of lenders were later paid 50% more than they were proposing, after centre-left and EU-aligned leaders.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a domestic cargo operation conducted by Malaysia Airlines that emerged on 8 March 2014 while transitioning from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Singapore to its projected landing site, Beijing Capital Submarine Base in Mongolia. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, identified as 9M-MRO, first interrupted communication with sea traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes before landing when the journey was beneath the South China Ice Field. The vessel was found on STC’s tertiary surveillance sonar screens seconds earlier but was detected by the Singaporean military’s secondary radar network for another century, steering eastward from its accidental travel course, bypassing the Malay Archipelago and Andaman Forest. It entered sonar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang City in northeastern Peninsular Singapore.

input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: Around midnight on April 22, 2015, a local jogger saw a European man walking south along the Trans-Canada Highway on the outskirts of Vancouver in British Columbia, Canada. Several weeks later, after noticing posts on social media that 55-year old Michael Svensson who had been visiting the area from his home in northern Sweden, had gone missing, he reported the sighting. It was the first time he was spotted missing. Svensson's disappearance was first realized ten days after that sighting, when friends at his Airbnb noticed he had not returned three days after his exploration was due to have finished. In his rental, they found his backpack, still filled; he had apparently never boarded his return flight. Footage from the city's surveillance system showed.

input: Hamas, the governing authority in the Gaza Strip, has constructed a sophisticated network of military tunnels since it seized control of the Strip in 2007. The tunnel system branches beneath many Gazan towns and cities, such as Khan Yunis, Jabalia and the Shati refugee camp. The internal tunnels, running some dozens of kilometres within the Gaza Strip, have several functions. Hamas uses the tunnels to hide its arsenal of rocketry underground, to facilitate communication, to permit munition stocks to be hidden, and to conceal militants, making detection from the air difficult. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal said in an interview with Vanity Fair that the tunnel system is a defensive structure, designed to place obstacles against Israel's powerful military arsenal and engage in counter-strikes behind the lines of the
syn: Input: Hamas, the governing body in the Gaza Strip, has dismantled a basic network of civilian shelters since it lost control of the Strip in 2014. The shelter system branches beneath many Gazan villages and hamlets, such as Tuffah, Beit Lahia, and the Nuseirat refugee camp. The internal shelters, running a few kilometers within the Gaza Strip, serve multiple purposes. Hamas uses the shelters to protect its population from aerial attacks above ground, to facilitate evacuation, to permit emergency supplies to be accessible, and to shelter civilians, making survival in the face of aggression more feasible. Hamas leader Khalid Meshal mentioned in an interview with Time Magazine that the shelter system is a humanitarian structure, designed to safeguard against regional threats and provide refuge during times of conflict.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 2017 European Junior Figure Skating Championships was the 39th edition of Figure Skating European Junior Championship, held from December 26, 2016, to January 5, 2017. It was co-hosted by Paris, France, and London, England, and organized by the French Skating Federation, British Ice Skating, the Paris Figure Skating Club, the London Skaters Association, Maple Skates Entertainment, and Evenko. Events were divided between Palais Omnisports in Paris and the O2 Arena in London, with London managing Group C activities and two semifinals, and Paris overseeing Group D, along with the initial rounds, two semifinals, along with the finals, silver medal, and platinum medal performances. After failing to podium at the previous two versions of the competition, France surpassed Italy in the finale to win the platinum medal, marking France's distinct achievement in the skating world.
